# 

<span key="9f463079de2244e89a58eca0ac4d83e4">**Accessibility**</span>

# 

<span key="28095920361b4b87b0237c65a213254b"><span offset-key="28095920361b4b87b0237c65a213254b:0">Why Accessibility?</span></span>

<span key="1e2e72cb989c4cbc9450b7e4438e2d87"><span offset-key="1e2e72cb989c4cbc9450b7e4438e2d87:0">Web accessibility (also referred to as </span></span><a href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/a11y" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="60db374bf0cb45df8be8bb2f8126f79d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="e251dd459cff4f09a56fe5a49f791e96"><strong>a11y</strong></span></span></a><span key="ec089fd962654f76a05718dd6d000b7d"><span offset-key="ec089fd962654f76a05718dd6d000b7d:0">) is the design and creation of websites that can be used by everyone. Accessibility support is necessary to allow assistive technology to interpret web pages.</span></span>

<span key="abfa38e2a6f44f37ac48cb0b67fcfe7b"><span offset-key="abfa38e2a6f44f37ac48cb0b67fcfe7b:0">React fully supports building accessible websites, often by using standard HTML techniques.</span></span>

# 

<span key="f56a4ad0560043508856bc58ad02689a"><span offset-key="f56a4ad0560043508856bc58ad02689a:0">Standards and Guidelines</span></span>

# 

<span key="ea22a1be1ff84247932e3838434e0f71"><span offset-key="ea22a1be1ff84247932e3838434e0f71:0">WCAG</span></span>

<span key="7a55b25bb1584169a32a0d4eb9761fd4"><span offset-key="7a55b25bb1584169a32a0d4eb9761fd4:0">The </span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/intro/wcag" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b296e33675624ac7b0b874df2709eaf0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="b302b5d10490437b91737bfc7273e3be"><span data-offset-key="b302b5d10490437b91737bfc7273e3be:0">Web Content Accessibility Guidelines</span></span></span></a><span key="f23689d3bca542c2adea75819d8d9d97"><span offset-key="f23689d3bca542c2adea75819d8d9d97:0"> provides guidelines for creating accessible web sites.</span></span>

<span key="6ea7f5e971464b0e8ecf0bd09cfd41ad"><span offset-key="6ea7f5e971464b0e8ecf0bd09cfd41ad:0">The following WCAG checklists provide an overview:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="c25cba3ff92f4138813f17ea4a9d5579"><span offset-key="c25cba3ff92f4138813f17ea4a9d5579:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.wuhcag.com/wcag-checklist/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fe0c3a5d2ffd44fc8cb328fa2a5909ef" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="37eddddb02c04fd889737aa7e031e4b2"><span data-offset-key="37eddddb02c04fd889737aa7e031e4b2:0">WCAG checklist from Wuhcag</span></span></span></a><span key="fa67c800ee2c49aa9eea0e8016f89976"><span offset-key="fa67c800ee2c49aa9eea0e8016f89976:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="1d5ec3e52a2c4913b451a02ea07bb7b0"><span offset-key="1d5ec3e52a2c4913b451a02ea07bb7b0:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/standards/wcag/checklist" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="be3a160b93ef45eca07680a002f0bc79" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="d846e858057b4649918e10a8b9667f27"><span data-offset-key="d846e858057b4649918e10a8b9667f27:0">WCAG checklist from WebAIM</span></span></span></a><span key="5e24a08dec6f49daaeb586d27cfd86c2"><span offset-key="5e24a08dec6f49daaeb586d27cfd86c2:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="84c503dc87f24f23a73c66928c195455"><span offset-key="84c503dc87f24f23a73c66928c195455:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://a11yproject.com/checklist.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8eaed2d60361484099957f3ad3528d99" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="4e40655f258c4d8c99191da0e69e862c"><span data-offset-key="4e40655f258c4d8c99191da0e69e862c:0">Checklist from The A11Y Project</span></span></span></a><span key="de630bf66cfd4c729ed4c7001662c911"><span offset-key="de630bf66cfd4c729ed4c7001662c911:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="f4c356c1d6f8421f832eb63b3387a9e4"><span offset-key="f4c356c1d6f8421f832eb63b3387a9e4:0">WAI-ARIA</span></span>

<span key="d93825ab8d2c4db78eaa710105251a4e"><span offset-key="d93825ab8d2c4db78eaa710105251a4e:0">The </span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/intro/aria" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0de7f9d32992403fb25c2a7150c090d7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="cbab1df6685c4dafa689866799aed141"><span data-offset-key="cbab1df6685c4dafa689866799aed141:0">Web Accessibility Initiative - Accessible Rich Internet Applications</span></span></span></a><span key="9ce0794bce4f4bb5952482151b219c0d"><span offset-key="9ce0794bce4f4bb5952482151b219c0d:0"> document contains techniques for building fully accessible JavaScript widgets.</span></span>

<span key="7b468584d54b4afba7d195d3f1a1e3ff"><span offset-key="7b468584d54b4afba7d195d3f1a1e3ff:0">Note that all </span>`aria-*`<span offset-key="7b468584d54b4afba7d195d3f1a1e3ff:2"> HTML attributes are fully supported in JSX. Whereas most DOM properties and attributes in React are camelCased, these attributes should be hyphen-cased (also known as kebab-case, lisp-case, etc) as they are in plain HTML:</span></span>

<span key="995a251a6a26496c8e8379f73c3412a8">`<input type="text" aria-label={labelText} aria-required="true" onChange={onchangeHandler}value={inputValue}name="name"/>`</span>

# 

<span key="382acef3b4074dc89f645188fb30e2ca"><span offset-key="382acef3b4074dc89f645188fb30e2ca:0">Semantic HTML</span></span>

<span key="fc7f617d6d564e528fedefb56821d53a"><span offset-key="fc7f617d6d564e528fedefb56821d53a:0">Semantic HTML is the foundation of accessibility in a web application. Using the various HTML elements to reinforce the meaning of information in our websites will often give us accessibility for free.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d7c23c14c66e4f59a86d7ef284425001"><span offset-key="d7c23c14c66e4f59a86d7ef284425001:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ed01270858cf4495a07b17bdc901c157" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="c564950c24ff4b15821173d37f3bf6bf"><span data-offset-key="c564950c24ff4b15821173d37f3bf6bf:0">MDN HTML elements reference</span></span></span></a><span key="57fa829bc61842e89ad24736fa570efc"><span offset-key="57fa829bc61842e89ad24736fa570efc:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="374c1f6aee9140cbb9dbc807d76a4405"><span offset-key="374c1f6aee9140cbb9dbc807d76a4405:0">Sometimes we break HTML semantics when we add </span>`<div>`<span offset-key="374c1f6aee9140cbb9dbc807d76a4405:2"> elements to our JSX to make our React code work, especially when working with lists (</span>`<ol>`<span offset-key="374c1f6aee9140cbb9dbc807d76a4405:4">, </span>`<ul>`<span offset-key="374c1f6aee9140cbb9dbc807d76a4405:6"> and </span>`<dl>`<span offset-key="374c1f6aee9140cbb9dbc807d76a4405:8">) and the HTML </span>`<table>`<span offset-key="374c1f6aee9140cbb9dbc807d76a4405:10">. In these cases we should rather use </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/fragments.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3d476fbfeda54140a12599dfd4274978" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="4a8635098708401da7fbf35aa832992a"><span data-offset-key="4a8635098708401da7fbf35aa832992a:0">React Fragments</span></span></span></a><span key="4835ea6cbd564df4ae99d5a270e56f73"><span offset-key="4835ea6cbd564df4ae99d5a270e56f73:0"> to group together multiple elements.</span></span>

<span key="0d7b28f2abf145549c7bf4c17a661458"><span offset-key="0d7b28f2abf145549c7bf4c17a661458:0">For example,</span></span>

<span key="cce5c0e68e9646d88c97b4c2a3f0bc59"><span offset-key="cce5c0e68e9646d88c97b4c2a3f0bc59:0">\`import React, { Fragment } from 'react';function ListItem({ item }) { return ( &lt;Fragment> &lt;dt>{item.term}&lt;/dt> &lt;dd>{item.description}&lt;/dd> &lt;/Fragment> ); }</span></span>

<span key="180a0c205e9e4dc6bb279755fe674e2a"><span offset-key="180a0c205e9e4dc6bb279755fe674e2a:0">function Glossary(props) { return ( &lt;dl> {props.items.map(item => ( &lt;ListItem item={item} key={</span></span><a href="http://item.id" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="cfb11d508563401eaf769fffdca1e57c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="2b267f62f3bd4a689cf371b33e03d03f"><span data-offset-key="2b267f62f3bd4a689cf371b33e03d03f:0">item.id</span></span></span></a><span key="be9c10c47083438cb91a8935a4cd6aa3"><span offset-key="be9c10c47083438cb91a8935a4cd6aa3:0">} />))} &lt;/dl>); }\`</span></span>

<span key="eecd78a5d6df4a7d8597461d03c303b6"><span offset-key="eecd78a5d6df4a7d8597461d03c303b6:0">You can map a collection of items to an array of fragments as you would any other type of element as well:</span></span>

<span key="96a28910570c43379b53b81632300c58">`function Glossary(props) { return ( <dl> {props.items.map(item => ( // Fragments should also have a`<span offset-key="96a28910570c43379b53b81632300c58:1">key</span>`prop when mapping collections <Fragment key={item.id}> <dt>{item.term}</dt> <dd>{item.description}</dd> </Fragment> ))} </dl>); }`</span>

<span key="e135bfe6026a443eb7ff920b598791f2"><span offset-key="e135bfe6026a443eb7ff920b598791f2:0">When you don’t need any props on the Fragment tag you can use the </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/fragments.html#short-syntax" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1f4b5d7cd1194a5b8e1949759032c87f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="c5d44f5faf9b468a8fc5c474c8d9fdd1"><span data-offset-key="c5d44f5faf9b468a8fc5c474c8d9fdd1:0">short syntax</span></span></span></a><span key="a85fe3c7f73f4a0ebcf508fec59ad299"><span offset-key="a85fe3c7f73f4a0ebcf508fec59ad299:0">, if your tooling supports it:</span></span>

<span key="b6424a0447724029bccdaa6597a30b82">`function ListItem({ item }) { return ( <> <dt>{item.term}</dt> <dd>{item.description}</dd> </> ); }`</span>

<span key="b7e0c9f361c748d88b8c7ccad45a1b62"><span offset-key="b7e0c9f361c748d88b8c7ccad45a1b62:0">For more info, see </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/fragments.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b28afc147d5f42d3872c7bbe24b2e9ec" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="1d85edb924f84c8bad6e323c65c0f81c"><span data-offset-key="1d85edb924f84c8bad6e323c65c0f81c:0">the Fragments documentation</span></span></span></a><span key="17634c209a9a43d2a2c79aa1b4f4861b"><span offset-key="17634c209a9a43d2a2c79aa1b4f4861b:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="07bf73ee355743218561d5c09e06f530"><span offset-key="07bf73ee355743218561d5c09e06f530:0">Accessible Forms</span></span>

# 

<span key="385778b0f6974ab5b4717e8752aae85d"><span offset-key="385778b0f6974ab5b4717e8752aae85d:0">Labeling</span></span>

<span key="9956a800ea7d4008b2bb8ce2f01e244d"><span offset-key="9956a800ea7d4008b2bb8ce2f01e244d:0">Every HTML form control, such as </span>`<input>`<span offset-key="9956a800ea7d4008b2bb8ce2f01e244d:2"> and </span>`<textarea>`<span offset-key="9956a800ea7d4008b2bb8ce2f01e244d:4">, needs to be labeled accessibly. We need to provide descriptive labels that are also exposed to screen readers.</span></span>

<span key="0cb23d05176847428176f409effd19e4"><span offset-key="0cb23d05176847428176f409effd19e4:0">The following resources show us how to do this:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="cdd69d1a6bbb4793b5499b2da68fc0e4"><span offset-key="cdd69d1a6bbb4793b5499b2da68fc0e4:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/tutorials/forms/labels/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="691d3ca5116b4b0fbdcd569b6220aa78" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="9be971d1cc3e49a58705ec6a3cb6254a"><span data-offset-key="9be971d1cc3e49a58705ec6a3cb6254a:0">The W3C shows us how to label elements</span></span></span></a><span key="fabfc39328584dc2bc5b23530840cef2"><span offset-key="fabfc39328584dc2bc5b23530840cef2:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="808bd8d4249b4d3784a6c263a8a107f8"><span offset-key="808bd8d4249b4d3784a6c263a8a107f8:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/techniques/forms/controls" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ef540562fa574cf795d9e359ba86204b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="58cc01cfcb76418a8b5cfd5c0969eb57"><span data-offset-key="58cc01cfcb76418a8b5cfd5c0969eb57:0">WebAIM shows us how to label elements</span></span></span></a><span key="e46429489e194d7e8fa245788f5b31e9"><span offset-key="e46429489e194d7e8fa245788f5b31e9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="3082251214674c79a69e655c0816696f"><span offset-key="3082251214674c79a69e655c0816696f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.paciellogroup.com/blog/2017/04/what-is-an-accessible-name/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6f0b9053f7a543d5a2711499949c35d2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="4f4c257b617b457d8db8f30230652bfd"><span data-offset-key="4f4c257b617b457d8db8f30230652bfd:0">The Paciello Group explains accessible names</span></span></span></a><span key="c3e143930d644c81bf18634daf9034b6"><span offset-key="c3e143930d644c81bf18634daf9034b6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="8be395fa0e624d76886115c3e06850bb"><span offset-key="8be395fa0e624d76886115c3e06850bb:0">Although these standard HTML practices can be directly used in React, note that the </span>`for`<span offset-key="8be395fa0e624d76886115c3e06850bb:2"> attribute is written as </span>`htmlFor`<span offset-key="8be395fa0e624d76886115c3e06850bb:4"> in JSX:</span></span>

<span key="366d8de1e87b48489904c7ca8ffabae1">`<label htmlFor="namedInput">Name:</label><input id="namedInput" type="text" name="name"/>`</span>

# 

<span key="f87d9b5dca2b43db908f9d55da535a6e"><span offset-key="f87d9b5dca2b43db908f9d55da535a6e:0">Notifying the user of errors</span></span>

<span key="e29138198be24843b00b4998a94e820e"><span offset-key="e29138198be24843b00b4998a94e820e:0">Error situations need to be understood by all users. The following link shows us how to expose error texts to screen readers as well:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="eb51ee4953ee481386a7aafc6d32eb55"><span offset-key="eb51ee4953ee481386a7aafc6d32eb55:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/tutorials/forms/notifications/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9e490a606dbf452da72d7862916bfc0f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="15f2541296d947ceaa477579a0108feb"><span data-offset-key="15f2541296d947ceaa477579a0108feb:0">The W3C demonstrates user notifications</span></span></span></a><span key="400cadf3336a4f9288e98ffbe234a5c7"><span offset-key="400cadf3336a4f9288e98ffbe234a5c7:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="42b63680f3a74203bd04a5113e466c53"><span offset-key="42b63680f3a74203bd04a5113e466c53:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/techniques/formvalidation/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a1bd8165ec84489a9afc0955fcd41f11" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="3189373d83644828aeff66a3f71da97f"><span data-offset-key="3189373d83644828aeff66a3f71da97f:0">WebAIM looks at form validation</span></span></span></a><span key="4a6d8cd23a5c47d49f2cfa856a719d3a"><span offset-key="4a6d8cd23a5c47d49f2cfa856a719d3a:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="54f4aa1b197448ca853bbd4ae7f5c1a1"><span offset-key="54f4aa1b197448ca853bbd4ae7f5c1a1:0">Focus Control</span></span>

<span key="87f920635bb24ce28b23bcdc64e3bc8e"><span offset-key="87f920635bb24ce28b23bcdc64e3bc8e:0">Ensure that your web application can be fully operated with the keyboard only:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="953c5a1bf0064974894827699de6ba99"><span offset-key="953c5a1bf0064974894827699de6ba99:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7293e643ab7c4e1cbca024ef8e74f7dd" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="dd76c1db1a0c4641941f9be316c23cbb"><span data-offset-key="dd76c1db1a0c4641941f9be316c23cbb:0">WebAIM talks about keyboard accessibility</span></span></span></a><span key="ded9105c92034350aec5fd9d954e9d02"><span offset-key="ded9105c92034350aec5fd9d954e9d02:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="93e1381db6c14452b6d0d8307137ccf3"><span offset-key="93e1381db6c14452b6d0d8307137ccf3:0">Keyboard focus and focus outline</span></span>

<span key="0b2e6d4a213845b99a8101ea2a13dadd"><span offset-key="0b2e6d4a213845b99a8101ea2a13dadd:0">Keyboard focus refers to the current element in the DOM that is selected to accept input from the keyboard. We see it everywhere as a focus outline similar to that shown in the following image:</span></span>

<span key="7ba6f68dbc9f4c2e87f15f8b0cac30bf"><span offset-key="7ba6f68dbc9f4c2e87f15f8b0cac30bf:0">https://reactjs.org/static/dec0e6bcc1f882baf76ebc860d4f04e5/4fcfe/keyboard-focus.png</span></span>

<span key="dbb318f139a047e48415672f3c61a1d3"><span offset-key="dbb318f139a047e48415672f3c61a1d3:0">Only ever use CSS that removes this outline, for example by setting </span>`outline: 0`<span offset-key="dbb318f139a047e48415672f3c61a1d3:2">, if you are replacing it with another focus outline implementation.</span></span>

# 

<span key="e3d72d3ccdfd49688ca8afda5ca7e9ed"><span offset-key="e3d72d3ccdfd49688ca8afda5ca7e9ed:0">Mechanisms to skip to desired content</span></span>

<span key="46e8c9fcb76e4c058e189eca94ba320e"><span offset-key="46e8c9fcb76e4c058e189eca94ba320e:0">Provide a mechanism to allow users to skip past navigation sections in your application as this assists and speeds up keyboard navigation.</span></span>

<span key="e08341d4d3044f62959b4ee3c112b84f"><span offset-key="e08341d4d3044f62959b4ee3c112b84f:0">Skiplinks or Skip Navigation Links are hidden navigation links that only become visible when keyboard users interact with the page. They are very easy to implement with internal page anchors and some styling:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="0856e0e327fb4dd5950f2c6ff377999f"><span offset-key="0856e0e327fb4dd5950f2c6ff377999f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/techniques/skipnav/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="cb92bfc32e364e438ecb5886830d0624" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="9db341ae200044f6b085ed0e08f35567"><span data-offset-key="9db341ae200044f6b085ed0e08f35567:0">WebAIM - Skip Navigation Links</span></span></span></a><span key="aa77296d675747009520248d117cb6e2"><span offset-key="aa77296d675747009520248d117cb6e2:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="ba8d8b22268a40d5ad67bfc1393dc226"><span offset-key="ba8d8b22268a40d5ad67bfc1393dc226:0">Also use landmark elements and roles, such as </span>`<main>`<span offset-key="ba8d8b22268a40d5ad67bfc1393dc226:2"> and </span>`<aside>`<span offset-key="ba8d8b22268a40d5ad67bfc1393dc226:4">, to demarcate page regions as assistive technology allow the user to quickly navigate to these sections.</span></span>

<span key="81b525c4673c4012b20b93e51d15da95"><span offset-key="81b525c4673c4012b20b93e51d15da95:0">Read more about the use of these elements to enhance accessibility here:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="7be3b15651db495d8eba891028537bc5"><span offset-key="7be3b15651db495d8eba891028537bc5:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.scottohara.me/blog/2018/03/03/landmarks.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fbba3ac9aa9c445bbd76f9cbba6212d2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="f9deea0c18ef42fa8b58367e3d707a27"><span data-offset-key="f9deea0c18ef42fa8b58367e3d707a27:0">Accessible Landmarks</span></span></span></a><span key="d066b8be29a34b868ec5b7ce59f4f1d1"><span offset-key="d066b8be29a34b868ec5b7ce59f4f1d1:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="21666f5d5b48429ca75694d2586226f4"><span offset-key="21666f5d5b48429ca75694d2586226f4:0">Programmatically managing focus</span></span>

<span key="f47a2b65042f4ad7954e640faf1bb616"><span offset-key="f47a2b65042f4ad7954e640faf1bb616:0">Our React applications continuously modify the HTML DOM during runtime, sometimes leading to keyboard focus being lost or set to an unexpected element. In order to repair this, we need to programmatically nudge the keyboard focus in the right direction. For example, by resetting keyboard focus to a button that opened a modal window after that modal window is closed.</span></span>

<span key="9e9f98cb13e14ee8900f34c0d67c1c3b"><span offset-key="9e9f98cb13e14ee8900f34c0d67c1c3b:0">MDN Web Docs takes a look at this and describes how we can build </span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/Keyboard-navigable_JavaScript_widgets" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="93b545cdfdfe4c34a8ff75af157dfde5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="3e36974fd97847a88498ac5612eb780a"><span data-offset-key="3e36974fd97847a88498ac5612eb780a:0">keyboard-navigable JavaScript widgets</span></span></span></a><span key="f159d8f9f84641ee95c5d73cdf74fad7"><span offset-key="f159d8f9f84641ee95c5d73cdf74fad7:0">.</span></span>

<span key="39eb41445d2a476b8f5c6875915c4fee"><span offset-key="39eb41445d2a476b8f5c6875915c4fee:0">To set focus in React, we can use </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/refs-and-the-dom.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="870012681b374422ad725c5e9398e170" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="b3414e1e305f4e65afc7679cc3fe5237"><span data-offset-key="b3414e1e305f4e65afc7679cc3fe5237:0">Refs to DOM elements</span></span></span></a><span key="478c56f459684ec2bf08234b3a41ce47"><span offset-key="478c56f459684ec2bf08234b3a41ce47:0">.</span></span>

<span key="261f2a09a4d4437a8bb754b465d68137"><span offset-key="261f2a09a4d4437a8bb754b465d68137:0">Using this, we first create a ref to an element in the JSX of a component class:</span></span>

<span key="5d9a935b35f34a848af0da6c719885c3">`class CustomTextInput extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props); // Create a ref to store the textInput DOM element this.textInput = React.createRef(); } render() { // Use the`<span offset-key="5d9a935b35f34a848af0da6c719885c3:1">ref</span>`callback to store a reference to the text input DOM // element in an instance field (for example, this.textInput). return ( <input type="text" ref={this.textInput} />); } }`</span>

<span key="064fa30fa991442ca09b25735e6d62ba"><span offset-key="064fa30fa991442ca09b25735e6d62ba:0">Then we can focus it elsewhere in our component when needed:</span></span>

<span key="675d3952373e46a38aec32488d75ccf9">`focus() { // Explicitly focus the text input using the raw DOM API // Note: we're accessing "current" to get the DOM node this.textInput.current.focus(); }`</span>

<span key="742adda9c9014c4ebc4263dd676a50bc"><span offset-key="742adda9c9014c4ebc4263dd676a50bc:0">Sometimes a parent component needs to set focus to an element in a child component. We can do this by </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/refs-and-the-dom.html#exposing-dom-refs-to-parent-components" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9ba5651d67aa41fa85dfe2f3298880ea" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="6411d354cbc34d7d9747ee64a216a692"><span data-offset-key="6411d354cbc34d7d9747ee64a216a692:0">exposing DOM refs to parent components</span></span></span></a><span key="2ac61f9d3596479b91c1fe2af973bb0f"><span offset-key="2ac61f9d3596479b91c1fe2af973bb0f:0"> through a special prop on the child component that forwards the parent’s ref to the child’s DOM node.</span></span>

<span key="18db627784e6453ea93b49f9dd6cc774"><span offset-key="18db627784e6453ea93b49f9dd6cc774:0">\`function CustomTextInput(props) { return ( &lt;div> &lt;input ref={props.inputRef} /> &lt;/div>); }</span></span>

<span key="6bbea46bd05045a1a2739ee335885961"><span offset-key="6bbea46bd05045a1a2739ee335885961:0">class Parent extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.inputElement = React.createRef(); } render() { return ( &lt;CustomTextInput inputRef={this.inputElement} /> ); } }</span></span>

<span key="c242c1b4037e4fb38f3fcc8f1b52c15e"><span offset-key="c242c1b4037e4fb38f3fcc8f1b52c15e:0">// Now you can set focus when required. this.inputElement.current.focus();\`</span></span>

<span key="815cf0ec051447d69fabbf94f9e1ae6b"><span offset-key="815cf0ec051447d69fabbf94f9e1ae6b:0">When using a HOC to extend components, it is recommended to </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/forwarding-refs.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7aec955f2fb24c3fbaef1cf572e6bf1d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="8c71cc1d149b4d9bbe48b1505ef68cdc"><span data-offset-key="8c71cc1d149b4d9bbe48b1505ef68cdc:0">forward the ref</span></span></span></a><span key="86132e1e545243f18014323dce345301"><span offset-key="86132e1e545243f18014323dce345301:0"> to the wrapped component using the </span>`forwardRef`<span offset-key="86132e1e545243f18014323dce345301:2"> function of React. If a third party HOC does not implement ref forwarding, the above pattern can still be used as a fallback.</span></span>

<span key="f4056d2fc21348579e162ea52186f174"><span offset-key="f4056d2fc21348579e162ea52186f174:0">A great focus management example is the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/davidtheclark/react-aria-modal" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="639d8d9df75244aebbdca33da6512a79" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="a443e7da4a0b475bb738437fb2a4291d"><span data-offset-key="a443e7da4a0b475bb738437fb2a4291d:0">react-aria-modal</span></span></span></a><span key="8945483658d94760b96688aba16f6ca2"><span offset-key="8945483658d94760b96688aba16f6ca2:0">. This is a relatively rare example of a fully accessible modal window. Not only does it set initial focus on the cancel button (preventing the keyboard user from accidentally activating the success action) and trap keyboard focus inside the modal, it also resets focus back to the element that initially triggered the modal.</span></span>

> <span key="0b6d073185cc4023a2fee7f19a5ea584"><span offset-key="0b6d073185cc4023a2fee7f19a5ea584:0">Note:While this is a very important accessibility feature, it is also a technique that should be used judiciously. Use it to repair the keyboard focus flow when it is disturbed, not to try and anticipate how users want to use applications.</span></span>

# 

<span key="5939b44b75ae4c518402c384b29ec49a"><span offset-key="5939b44b75ae4c518402c384b29ec49a:0">Mouse and pointer events</span></span>

<span key="4b438cb6e21548b182244920157d5962"><span offset-key="4b438cb6e21548b182244920157d5962:0">Ensure that all functionality exposed through a mouse or pointer event can also be accessed using the keyboard alone. Depending only on the pointer device will lead to many cases where keyboard users cannot use your application.</span></span>

<span key="b8afd832f82446788969156215cfe62b"><span offset-key="b8afd832f82446788969156215cfe62b:0">To illustrate this, let’s look at a prolific example of broken accessibility caused by click events. This is the outside click pattern, where a user can disable an opened popover by clicking outside the element.</span></span>

<span key="04598403024847fc8c96fd10e2884a81"><span offset-key="04598403024847fc8c96fd10e2884a81:0">https://reactjs.org/5523b05b22210c5a2fa0bd1f01339cb3/outerclick-with-mouse.gif</span></span>

<span key="2b0bdce95c404e4799e45bf72c1bb9c5"><span offset-key="2b0bdce95c404e4799e45bf72c1bb9c5:0">This is typically implemented by attaching a </span>`click`<span offset-key="2b0bdce95c404e4799e45bf72c1bb9c5:2"> event to the </span>`window`<span offset-key="2b0bdce95c404e4799e45bf72c1bb9c5:4"> object that closes the popover:</span></span>

<span key="5b25b2f769794d6b8dd2c71b82bc6f1a"><span offset-key="5b25b2f769794d6b8dd2c71b82bc6f1a:0">\`class OuterClickExample extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props);</span></span>

1

<span key="1eb5c080a78e4a7fbe5f6c7392b181f6"><span offset-key="1eb5c080a78e4a7fbe5f6c7392b181f6:0">this.state = { isOpen: false };</span></span>

2

<span key="f82f601763794336baa1a4a5335061c5"><span offset-key="f82f601763794336baa1a4a5335061c5:0">this.toggleContainer = React.createRef();</span></span>

3

<span key="197ddca19e324a8e966f9c974549eb08"><span offset-key="197ddca19e324a8e966f9c974549eb08:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="d8357bdba1d44b9c92422bfe5247cbe9"><span offset-key="d8357bdba1d44b9c92422bfe5247cbe9:0">this.onClickHandler = this.onClickHandler.bind(this);</span></span>

5

<span key="7dc05f2e5c7f41e48c63c2bba6294536"><span offset-key="7dc05f2e5c7f41e48c63c2bba6294536:0">this.onClickOutsideHandler = this.onClickOutsideHandler.bind(this);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="75c410226c064f47a7d015cea9b04366"><span offset-key="75c410226c064f47a7d015cea9b04366:0">}</span></span>

<span key="6f0164b25aea4b08ad66af829ec156b7"><span offset-key="6f0164b25aea4b08ad66af829ec156b7:0">componentDidMount() { window.addEventListener('click', this.onClickOutsideHandler); }componentWillUnmount() { window.removeEventListener('click', this.onClickOutsideHandler); }</span></span>

<span key="2651e788d74f40d4bb226d7fd5bb47fc"><span offset-key="2651e788d74f40d4bb226d7fd5bb47fc:0">onClickHandler() { this.setState(currentState => ({ isOpen: !currentState.isOpen })); }</span></span>

<span key="d9004a512fb2486ba496747a0e9e68e2"><span offset-key="d9004a512fb2486ba496747a0e9e68e2:0">onClickOutsideHandler(event) { if (this.state.isOpen && !this.toggleContainer.current.contains(event.target)) { this.setState({ isOpen: false }); } }render() { return ( &lt;div ref={this.toggleContainer}> &lt;button onClick={this.onClickHandler}>Select an option&lt;/button> {this.state.isOpen && ( &lt;ul> &lt;li>Option 1&lt;/li> &lt;li>Option 2&lt;/li> &lt;li>Option 3&lt;/li> &lt;/ul>)} &lt;/div>); } }\`</span></span>

<span key="5ec990a208c14cd794f0133fa5bb0a1d"><span offset-key="5ec990a208c14cd794f0133fa5bb0a1d:0">This may work fine for users with pointer devices, such as a mouse, but operating this with the keyboard alone leads to broken functionality when tabbing to the next element as the </span>`window`<span offset-key="5ec990a208c14cd794f0133fa5bb0a1d:2"> object never receives a </span>`click`<span offset-key="5ec990a208c14cd794f0133fa5bb0a1d:4"> event. This can lead to obscured functionality which blocks users from using your application.</span></span>

<span key="fa145e29bb6047a09df1dd1a456f5d82"><span offset-key="fa145e29bb6047a09df1dd1a456f5d82:0">https://reactjs.org/eca0ca825c8c5e2aa609cee72ef47e27/outerclick-with-keyboard.gif</span></span>

<span key="31d56443676445cb85b228722c5507c4"><span offset-key="31d56443676445cb85b228722c5507c4:0">The same functionality can be achieved by using appropriate event handlers instead, such as </span>`onBlur`<span offset-key="31d56443676445cb85b228722c5507c4:2"> and </span>`onFocus`<span offset-key="31d56443676445cb85b228722c5507c4:4">:</span></span>

<span key="0fcbef71ef4f41ac92dd8e4b118a80fa"><span offset-key="0fcbef71ef4f41ac92dd8e4b118a80fa:0">\`class BlurExample extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props);</span></span>

1

<span key="b2ee84a7b4e64c94953229c9b330bc81"><span offset-key="b2ee84a7b4e64c94953229c9b330bc81:0">this.state = { isOpen: false };</span></span>

2

<span key="3f57fc8a3baf42d99d780de9a0f330fb"><span offset-key="3f57fc8a3baf42d99d780de9a0f330fb:0">this.timeOutId = null;</span></span>

3

<span key="edabad05da4a4d948853822ef459d30b"><span offset-key="edabad05da4a4d948853822ef459d30b:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="6776a38f7b0f4ad99612793ce5aaf2c0"><span offset-key="6776a38f7b0f4ad99612793ce5aaf2c0:0">this.onClickHandler = this.onClickHandler.bind(this);</span></span>

5

<span key="52661e24ddae47ce99bf84cc82b7aea5"><span offset-key="52661e24ddae47ce99bf84cc82b7aea5:0">this.onBlurHandler = this.onBlurHandler.bind(this);</span></span>

6

<span key="4cf965f6a1d846dfa79bbe9449d83bb4"><span offset-key="4cf965f6a1d846dfa79bbe9449d83bb4:0">this.onFocusHandler = this.onFocusHandler.bind(this);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="417239dc2e2d4d80977b9d2b9021101b"><span offset-key="417239dc2e2d4d80977b9d2b9021101b:0">}</span></span>

<span key="d81e65bbb86b47d78b29118bb953c51a"><span offset-key="d81e65bbb86b47d78b29118bb953c51a:0">onClickHandler() { this.setState(currentState => ({ isOpen: !currentState.isOpen })); }</span></span>

<span key="86728f0d72754e619f971b7cbd31e788"><span offset-key="86728f0d72754e619f971b7cbd31e788:0">// We close the popover on the next tick by using setTimeout. // This is necessary because we need to first check if // another child of the element has received focus as // the blur event fires prior to the new focus event. onBlurHandler() { this.timeOutId = setTimeout(() => { this.setState({ isOpen: false }); }); } // If a child receives focus, do not close the popover. onFocusHandler() { clearTimeout(this.timeOutId); }render() { // React assists us by bubbling the blur and // focus events to the parent. return ( &lt;div onBlur={this.onBlurHandler} onFocus={this.onFocusHandler}> &lt;button onClick={this.onClickHandler}aria-haspopup="true"aria-expanded={this.state.isOpen}> Select an option &lt;/button> {this.state.isOpen && ( &lt;ul> &lt;li>Option 1&lt;/li> &lt;li>Option 2&lt;/li> &lt;li>Option 3&lt;/li> &lt;/ul>)} &lt;/div>); } }\`</span></span>

<span key="e2c88aee9a0f430cb28d5a6d2c8157f0"><span offset-key="e2c88aee9a0f430cb28d5a6d2c8157f0:0">This code exposes the functionality to both pointer device and keyboard users. Also note the added </span>`aria-*`<span offset-key="e2c88aee9a0f430cb28d5a6d2c8157f0:2"> props to support screen-reader users. For simplicity’s sake the keyboard events to enable </span>`arrow key`<span offset-key="e2c88aee9a0f430cb28d5a6d2c8157f0:4"> interaction of the popover options have not been implemented.</span></span>

<span key="94b76488b23348ae9a560d7003655c55"><span offset-key="94b76488b23348ae9a560d7003655c55:0">https://reactjs.org/28ce2067489843caf05fe7ce22494542/blur-popover-close.gif</span></span>

<span key="9baf635b730d4b42abdd838946b50b90"><span offset-key="9baf635b730d4b42abdd838946b50b90:0">This is one example of many cases where depending on only pointer and mouse events will break functionality for keyboard users. Always testing with the keyboard will immediately highlight the problem areas which can then be fixed by using keyboard aware event handlers.</span></span>

# 

<span key="b8507d80362043968ace51c6cda52ba3"><span offset-key="b8507d80362043968ace51c6cda52ba3:0">More Complex Widgets</span></span>

<span key="6855dc6ab7ae4415b15dae7bc30227b8"><span offset-key="6855dc6ab7ae4415b15dae7bc30227b8:0">A more complex user experience should not mean a less accessible one. Whereas accessibility is most easily achieved by coding as close to HTML as possible, even the most complex widget can be coded accessibly.</span></span>

<span key="42f633dcdb0b46b6a0bd6669d0d19822"><span offset-key="42f633dcdb0b46b6a0bd6669d0d19822:0">Here we require knowledge of </span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/#roles" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e98b69d3e369464e8ba12b1c429dddd1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="b83b1a874157404ca1889f3d0bd109d6"><span data-offset-key="b83b1a874157404ca1889f3d0bd109d6:0">ARIA Roles</span></span></span></a><span key="a40804d71f7b4c04a0ae1a0dce7df205"><span offset-key="a40804d71f7b4c04a0ae1a0dce7df205:0"> as well as </span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/#states_and_properties" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="015ce23aadc24ffc833696b8078f0f0d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="333955edacd948a0b2b3893d5ae8391f"><span data-offset-key="333955edacd948a0b2b3893d5ae8391f:0">ARIA States and Properties</span></span></span></a><span key="181fbf48a26c4dd3a8da4e1f47205df5"><span offset-key="181fbf48a26c4dd3a8da4e1f47205df5:0">. These are toolboxes filled with HTML attributes that are fully supported in JSX and enable us to construct fully accessible, highly functional React components.</span></span>

<span key="78baafe3424a4ef1a15d3079cc63d6da"><span offset-key="78baafe3424a4ef1a15d3079cc63d6da:0">Each type of widget has a specific design pattern and is expected to function in a certain way by users and user agents alike:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1a9891b4d5f54174b9dc09ed91a35a43"><span offset-key="1a9891b4d5f54174b9dc09ed91a35a43:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#aria_ex" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="60c6fff9f5754fbbb4ac0db88bd45206" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="2189eabd7c3344229e4fb6dbb55350bc"><span data-offset-key="2189eabd7c3344229e4fb6dbb55350bc:0">WAI-ARIA Authoring Practices - Design Patterns and Widgets</span></span></span></a><span key="21dc98b52e7f4164a45e7b2a2e3527fc"><span offset-key="21dc98b52e7f4164a45e7b2a2e3527fc:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dfc6c1a5de644ef09ad7404835f4c813"><span offset-key="dfc6c1a5de644ef09ad7404835f4c813:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://heydonworks.com/article/practical-aria-examples/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3d7a4f811ffb4bd99795622080f71598" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="6dddd36686ba4dbb9e02975ab72cca61"><span data-offset-key="6dddd36686ba4dbb9e02975ab72cca61:0">Heydon Pickering - ARIA Examples</span></span></span></a><span key="ec65a7fa6f6f4eae9b342bc40aac0b64"><span offset-key="ec65a7fa6f6f4eae9b342bc40aac0b64:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="cbf1c5af1d6f47c1a1d9bf05d34c1f2c"><span offset-key="cbf1c5af1d6f47c1a1d9bf05d34c1f2c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://inclusive-components.design" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a292f68436cb442183b0e0f18bbf8007" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="22319e8ee10f47709826400e0333718e"><span data-offset-key="22319e8ee10f47709826400e0333718e:0">Inclusive Components</span></span></span></a><span key="f21a60dcc01f46c3bbdf792de2eb91c2"><span offset-key="f21a60dcc01f46c3bbdf792de2eb91c2:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="f2c411cff91048a08dae05c766702c3c"><span offset-key="f2c411cff91048a08dae05c766702c3c:0">Setting the language</span></span>

<span key="ceabfcb3a4f140089d53508f183046dc"><span offset-key="ceabfcb3a4f140089d53508f183046dc:0">Indicate the human language of page texts as screen reader software uses this to select the correct voice settings:</span></span>

    <span key="22f24eca8cda4af4aa1318f917057e87"><span offset-key="22f24eca8cda4af4aa1318f917057e87:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/techniques/screenreader/#language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="389b2309248a438f89c9166d77e240e1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="cec2ca2e0fd44f47bf8f0a2ef28cb732"><span data-offset-key="cec2ca2e0fd44f47bf8f0a2ef28cb732:0">WebAIM - Document Language</span></span></span></a><span key="8a183f5105a54f239bf3962957db24c5"><span offset-key="8a183f5105a54f239bf3962957db24c5:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="6ea3612ec76b4f43b488d17e9485911d"><span offset-key="6ea3612ec76b4f43b488d17e9485911d:0">Setting the document title</span></span>

<span key="b3100c930c6d4c4385bc21fe5bc2ae68"><span offset-key="b3100c930c6d4c4385bc21fe5bc2ae68:0">Set the document </span>`<title>`<span offset-key="b3100c930c6d4c4385bc21fe5bc2ae68:2"> to correctly describe the current page content as this ensures that the user remains aware of the current page context:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b69b4dea8a7a443a9bd1f0fb59189743"><span offset-key="b69b4dea8a7a443a9bd1f0fb59189743:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-title.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a406e918656b4a1b8b56659f38c24afa" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="def84e0a3f3c4b4fa387466ae85869ed"><span data-offset-key="def84e0a3f3c4b4fa387466ae85869ed:0">WCAG - Understanding the Document Title Requirement</span></span></span></a><span key="c0b3d3df4c454f0b941857597a2c1d1f"><span offset-key="c0b3d3df4c454f0b941857597a2c1d1f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="5ee1cafd1a884a07bf727c3a6a56329d"><span offset-key="5ee1cafd1a884a07bf727c3a6a56329d:0">We can set this in React using the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/gaearon/react-document-title" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="63225a1003d04855a1fe55c5f6347ba9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="c990b903ca054d38985b7799795e2c60"><span data-offset-key="c990b903ca054d38985b7799795e2c60:0">React Document Title Component</span></span></span></a><span key="207a7cb96ff345499cf0b6a9ba4b763d"><span offset-key="207a7cb96ff345499cf0b6a9ba4b763d:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="85e5f5fb458a4fb1a875e05a5a4bee6d"><span offset-key="85e5f5fb458a4fb1a875e05a5a4bee6d:0">Color contrast</span></span>

<span key="d6c94663b37744498f11acdb26a115c1"><span offset-key="d6c94663b37744498f11acdb26a115c1:0">Ensure that all readable text on your website has sufficient color contrast to remain maximally readable by users with low vision:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="325ac6b8423b4b5188734aa06cf08fec"><span offset-key="325ac6b8423b4b5188734aa06cf08fec:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/visual-audio-contrast-contrast.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a9485dd4f8ac467e9a10f1ea95526c30" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="c99da21c6110470b9bab967ac9714444"><span data-offset-key="c99da21c6110470b9bab967ac9714444:0">WCAG - Understanding the Color Contrast Requirement</span></span></span></a><span key="a87fb03389bf41f5a6c004b23a7eff7e"><span offset-key="a87fb03389bf41f5a6c004b23a7eff7e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8f9f6bd3bdd74c54bf1a61dbb8c4a09e"><span offset-key="8f9f6bd3bdd74c54bf1a61dbb8c4a09e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2014/10/color-contrast-tips-and-tools-for-accessibility/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d3c919a2763e47aaaf1ebe5de2c3f32a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="03466c64d0694d46bbdff725ec011ba9"><span data-offset-key="03466c64d0694d46bbdff725ec011ba9:0">Everything About Color Contrast And Why You Should Rethink It</span></span></span></a><span key="8c961ba462594140990e908774c2bd2d"><span offset-key="8c961ba462594140990e908774c2bd2d:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="16edf2751ec3470daf99d26ef62a205c"><span offset-key="16edf2751ec3470daf99d26ef62a205c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://a11yproject.com/posts/what-is-color-contrast/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fd55fe86e5e24e8593470eb6403a56da" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="db0fecf6b0e2436f8450ab222f2100ca"><span data-offset-key="db0fecf6b0e2436f8450ab222f2100ca:0">A11yProject - What is Color Contrast</span></span></span></a><span key="a92e4389fd72413c9d922ca18c3ea0db"><span offset-key="a92e4389fd72413c9d922ca18c3ea0db:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="5bbaab779deb405e856287333ee389f8"><span offset-key="5bbaab779deb405e856287333ee389f8:0">It can be tedious to manually calculate the proper color combinations for all cases in your website so instead, you can </span></span><a href="https://jxnblk.com/colorable/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f5c02ccb53874926b06551a82c125bd9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="59307184f54d49c094d3d872d1cbfa98"><span data-offset-key="59307184f54d49c094d3d872d1cbfa98:0">calculate an entire accessible color palette with Colorable</span></span></span></a><span key="70e71b39ac244b56a3476bc9948b2795"><span offset-key="70e71b39ac244b56a3476bc9948b2795:0">.</span></span>

<span key="5f898a46362d4c18ab1f59ebd8535359"><span offset-key="5f898a46362d4c18ab1f59ebd8535359:0">Both the aXe and WAVE tools mentioned below also include color contrast tests and will report on contrast errors.</span></span>

<span key="f0dd0776a70349b2a808a300e1f51679"><span offset-key="f0dd0776a70349b2a808a300e1f51679:0">If you want to extend your contrast testing abilities you can use these tools:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="903118a8b48746909c31784199b001b6"><span offset-key="903118a8b48746909c31784199b001b6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="581e46ae945c46b68208e7c4f1bbfa76" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="d09ffae1f08f4225b94746b42b9df096"><span data-offset-key="d09ffae1f08f4225b94746b42b9df096:0">WebAIM - Color Contrast Checker</span></span></span></a><span key="a3c04be80a1f4135afef78740f64f481"><span offset-key="a3c04be80a1f4135afef78740f64f481:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d123f186c5ce4cb9bcddebbbc19748c8"><span offset-key="d123f186c5ce4cb9bcddebbbc19748c8:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.paciellogroup.com/resources/contrastanalyser/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1e6d63c0fd7b426b9f05dd9d388306e5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="bbfdfd4048ac425293a5842bca3f2aa3"><span data-offset-key="bbfdfd4048ac425293a5842bca3f2aa3:0">The Paciello Group - Color Contrast Analyzer</span></span></span></a><span key="e15e7609589f4e28b6a30edd5e36ade7"><span offset-key="e15e7609589f4e28b6a30edd5e36ade7:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="1e01d4d6f8684cf0899b9422ad100ad6"><span offset-key="1e01d4d6f8684cf0899b9422ad100ad6:0">Development and Testing Tools</span></span>

<span key="0042795e79154f3b9d39a34f20c72e10"><span offset-key="0042795e79154f3b9d39a34f20c72e10:0">There are a number of tools we can use to assist in the creation of accessible web applications.</span></span>

# 

<span key="107d2988bb5b4bc9aad13a58108e15f3"><span offset-key="107d2988bb5b4bc9aad13a58108e15f3:0">The keyboard</span></span>

<span key="20b1adb1e58a4f889f2922ccba0e33b3"><span offset-key="20b1adb1e58a4f889f2922ccba0e33b3:0">By far the easiest and also one of the most important checks is to test if your entire website can be reached and used with the keyboard alone. Do this by:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="2508a0a422594f9c92abe915277537ef"><span offset-key="2508a0a422594f9c92abe915277537ef:0">Disconnecting your mouse.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="dbe1c6b01e6845368a99373edfaf7f53"><span offset-key="dbe1c6b01e6845368a99373edfaf7f53:0">Using </span>`Tab`<span offset-key="dbe1c6b01e6845368a99373edfaf7f53:2"> and </span>`Shift+Tab`<span offset-key="dbe1c6b01e6845368a99373edfaf7f53:4"> to browse.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="3868b10249d5473db4629faf71b95f25"><span offset-key="3868b10249d5473db4629faf71b95f25:0">Using </span>`Enter`<span offset-key="3868b10249d5473db4629faf71b95f25:2"> to activate elements.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="2a00024fda1d4ba986554da5b47e0774"><span offset-key="2a00024fda1d4ba986554da5b47e0774:0">Where required, using your keyboard arrow keys to interact with some elements, such as menus and dropdowns.</span></span>

# 

<span key="220d30060bd8457aae94f616b15f6ec8"><span offset-key="220d30060bd8457aae94f616b15f6ec8:0">Development assistance</span></span>

<span key="e1375c16f195405a9c14f2852f0697da"><span offset-key="e1375c16f195405a9c14f2852f0697da:0">We can check some accessibility features directly in our JSX code. Often intellisense checks are already provided in JSX aware IDE’s for the ARIA roles, states and properties. We also have access to the following tool:</span></span>

### 

<span key="5c0561b05ac6428a97a1eacafe6a3b67"><span offset-key="5c0561b05ac6428a97a1eacafe6a3b67:0">eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y</span></span>

<span key="641d3fde82dc4e2b90d2e2aa18ca82bb"><span offset-key="641d3fde82dc4e2b90d2e2aa18ca82bb:0">The </span></span><a href="https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8a731bf29dd14240982a9bf08894620d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="dd73419a2bf64e3a92cd2a9f15312436"><span data-offset-key="dd73419a2bf64e3a92cd2a9f15312436:0">eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y</span></span></span></a><span key="389f800f1bc14c5f8ee667ff2e9cf66b"><span offset-key="389f800f1bc14c5f8ee667ff2e9cf66b:0"> plugin for ESLint provides AST linting feedback regarding accessibility issues in your JSX. Many IDE’s allow you to integrate these findings directly into code analysis and source code windows.</span></span>

<span key="74afbcd52ef849eab4849755750952d6"><span offset-key="74afbcd52ef849eab4849755750952d6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f1c79f283265471a83f5e86b7183fd2c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="57648a5424e94e86a146f660899e847b"><span data-offset-key="57648a5424e94e86a146f660899e847b:0">Create React App</span></span></span></a><span key="f0cc45b15f6641e1bb33a3c8717a5e10"><span offset-key="f0cc45b15f6641e1bb33a3c8717a5e10:0"> has this plugin with a subset of rules activated. If you want to enable even more accessibility rules, you can create an </span>`.eslintrc`<span offset-key="f0cc45b15f6641e1bb33a3c8717a5e10:2"> file in the root of your project with this content:</span></span>

1

<span key="a515f2abcc5c4c278122149f12ef2e3a"><span offset-key="a515f2abcc5c4c278122149f12ef2e3a:0">{</span></span>

2

<span key="fd32463e9dbb48ae91309652bdd56571"><span offset-key="fd32463e9dbb48ae91309652bdd56571:0"> "extends": \["react-app", "plugin:jsx-a11y/recommended"\],</span></span>

3

<span key="ea83ee786f254ef7acb020685f132fd1"><span offset-key="ea83ee786f254ef7acb020685f132fd1:0"> "plugins": \["jsx-a11y"\]</span></span>

4

<span key="f1d82b26a2c64592a9f36600da10fd5f"><span offset-key="f1d82b26a2c64592a9f36600da10fd5f:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

# 

<span key="be0fa9bc666e43e38aa7d1409da7b600"><span offset-key="be0fa9bc666e43e38aa7d1409da7b600:0">Testing accessibility in the browser</span></span>

<span key="9d982f80539b4872bb9712183ff6b088"><span offset-key="9d982f80539b4872bb9712183ff6b088:0">A number of tools exist that can run accessibility audits on web pages in your browser. Please use them in combination with other accessibility checks mentioned here as they can only test the technical accessibility of your HTML.</span></span>

### 

<span key="f08893086b9c47f79d31dffd6fb1edd7"><span offset-key="f08893086b9c47f79d31dffd6fb1edd7:0">aXe, aXe-core and react-axe</span></span>

<span key="cbaaac13dc1245c29ff5137cafdd9085"><span offset-key="cbaaac13dc1245c29ff5137cafdd9085:0">Deque Systems offers </span></span><a href="https://github.com/dequelabs/axe-core" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fd09ec2aad6e457ba29e432466d34ea8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="428aefb3d22e474cb070c25dd1ae279f"><span data-offset-key="428aefb3d22e474cb070c25dd1ae279f:0">aXe-core</span></span></span></a><span key="f16f45c07a294b2aa04571efdfdbb457"><span offset-key="f16f45c07a294b2aa04571efdfdbb457:0"> for automated and end-to-end accessibility tests of your applications. This module includes integrations for Selenium.</span></span>

<span key="d28a8ad9b5114b3bb981b2e70726dd6b"><span offset-key="d28a8ad9b5114b3bb981b2e70726dd6b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.deque.com/products/axe/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b7bb70445f264bb4aa89691b9a116f58" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="b8292d1c0a7a4e469d4c6945eb32cf0b"><span data-offset-key="b8292d1c0a7a4e469d4c6945eb32cf0b:0">The Accessibility Engine</span></span></span></a><span key="6de8e29ce8114dbca338bd001e0e3658"><span offset-key="6de8e29ce8114dbca338bd001e0e3658:0"> or aXe, is an accessibility inspector browser extension built on </span>`aXe-core`<span offset-key="6de8e29ce8114dbca338bd001e0e3658:2">.</span></span>

<span key="98c540369d754f45854a1c2a20fa50e0"><span offset-key="98c540369d754f45854a1c2a20fa50e0:0">You can also use the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/dylanb/react-axe" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="32933d9637974057af4c14caef0096a0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="19e55eb3c1c94b0e86ae820a84da2028"><span data-offset-key="19e55eb3c1c94b0e86ae820a84da2028:0">react-axe</span></span></span></a><span key="ea4363497e324c3d85bb4e0cb403ef46"><span offset-key="ea4363497e324c3d85bb4e0cb403ef46:0"> module to report these accessibility findings directly to the console while developing and debugging.</span></span>

### 

<span key="b987f45e668a4d8484153bcc315f7a29"><span offset-key="b987f45e668a4d8484153bcc315f7a29:0">WebAIM WAVE</span></span>

<span key="e47714e92ffc40528e3b9e6dbe41ccb0"><span offset-key="e47714e92ffc40528e3b9e6dbe41ccb0:0">The </span></span><a href="https://wave.webaim.org/extension/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a1a2cb6ac48a46aba114c88605baaf68" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="89ac6411c2bb4e26ad3286a4c3b37512"><span data-offset-key="89ac6411c2bb4e26ad3286a4c3b37512:0">Web Accessibility Evaluation Tool</span></span></span></a><span key="2125d29b849c4ce6b83ee2b0d5d677b0"><span offset-key="2125d29b849c4ce6b83ee2b0d5d677b0:0"> is another accessibility browser extension.</span></span>

### 

<span key="a5950a57c6b4413b974b04259694914b"><span offset-key="a5950a57c6b4413b974b04259694914b:0">Accessibility inspectors and the Accessibility Tree</span></span>

<span key="b4ef180e8e1a4553ae63e80b918305fc"><span offset-key="b4ef180e8e1a4553ae63e80b918305fc:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.paciellogroup.com/blog/2015/01/the-browser-accessibility-tree/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ac1007a981804a169eda348a8adb0565" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="eb44237d0eb54e2894583f1797007f73"><span data-offset-key="eb44237d0eb54e2894583f1797007f73:0">The Accessibility Tree</span></span></span></a><span key="98e908621bd6403f83643664513eb729"><span offset-key="98e908621bd6403f83643664513eb729:0"> is a subset of the DOM tree that contains accessible objects for every DOM element that should be exposed to assistive technology, such as screen readers.</span></span>

<span key="05b7fdbd2c1541379f94eec85d33e9c5"><span offset-key="05b7fdbd2c1541379f94eec85d33e9c5:0">In some browsers we can easily view the accessibility information for each element in the accessibility tree:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="128c9fcb4e324f07abc6890155942437"><span offset-key="128c9fcb4e324f07abc6890155942437:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Accessibility_inspector" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f8e5023f7b554b17807bf3ca2135bb1d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="b05746b9ae454c8c9d1b173c52655260"><span data-offset-key="b05746b9ae454c8c9d1b173c52655260:0">Using the Accessibility Inspector in Firefox</span></span></span></a><span key="9ff8e9e0b28f4972acb68686ac5052e6"><span offset-key="9ff8e9e0b28f4972acb68686ac5052e6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2c10107a8653430a8a5883c8a9331e8e"><span offset-key="2c10107a8653430a8a5883c8a9331e8e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/accessibility/reference#pane" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0e890def8cec43c5bddbf2150341e181" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="425db01671374eef986a93803f74ff52"><span data-offset-key="425db01671374eef986a93803f74ff52:0">Using the Accessibility Inspector in Chrome</span></span></span></a><span key="1fdf226a005a4bafa3fafebe2d0055fb"><span offset-key="1fdf226a005a4bafa3fafebe2d0055fb:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4375855aebd84937bd80b1d61a8e9c64"><span offset-key="4375855aebd84937bd80b1d61a8e9c64:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://developer.apple.com/library/content/documentation/Accessibility/Conceptual/AccessibilityMacOSX/OSXAXTestingApps.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8a6ef0058dc24c009a8b9f0f06d81af7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="8535e2162439413daf024d7eac6ea55a"><span data-offset-key="8535e2162439413daf024d7eac6ea55a:0">Using the Accessibility Inspector in OS X Safari</span></span></span></a><span key="d168c04b0d604e3d827b41a277de3c75"><span offset-key="d168c04b0d604e3d827b41a277de3c75:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="ba4f374253144b7286c543e1a668ddb3"><span offset-key="ba4f374253144b7286c543e1a668ddb3:0">Screen readers</span></span>

<span key="ab808a78dcf048329a4420cf37c7d198"><span offset-key="ab808a78dcf048329a4420cf37c7d198:0">Testing with a screen reader should form part of your accessibility tests.</span></span>

<span key="86eb91b75e924db08464fa65cbd5f8d3"><span offset-key="86eb91b75e924db08464fa65cbd5f8d3:0">Please note that browser / screen reader combinations matter. It is recommended that you test your application in the browser best suited to your screen reader of choice.</span></span>

# 

<span key="6fe3fc3af9eb44d1a51390e907719a37"><span offset-key="6fe3fc3af9eb44d1a51390e907719a37:0">Commonly Used Screen Readers</span></span>

### 

<span key="2f1d8314729f4c2ca722fe33445a48d3"><span offset-key="2f1d8314729f4c2ca722fe33445a48d3:0">NVDA in Firefox</span></span>

<span key="43b95f1b2d3f45afb33271ec214a0b6d"><span offset-key="43b95f1b2d3f45afb33271ec214a0b6d:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.nvaccess.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2d31db289bdb48cdbbe73a1fdad94cb9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="3671d1cd47324ff7bff6e41e6f62febd"><span data-offset-key="3671d1cd47324ff7bff6e41e6f62febd:0">NonVisual Desktop Access</span></span></span></a><span key="48ae6f28bac94c319df75927b958323c"><span offset-key="48ae6f28bac94c319df75927b958323c:0"> or NVDA is an open source Windows screen reader that is widely used.</span></span>

<span key="916ba4d745734842bff8c20db2362910"><span offset-key="916ba4d745734842bff8c20db2362910:0">Refer to the following guides on how to best use NVDA:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

<span key="230095b6275741df9f64503933172d5c"><span offset-key="230095b6275741df9f64503933172d5c:0">JAWS in Internet Explorer</span></span>

# 

<span key="8abfbbaee0ba46fab4134c6561a50c4d">**Code-Splitting**</span>

# 

<span key="a90da58ae0d44ac0a5216c3db526993a"><span offset-key="a90da58ae0d44ac0a5216c3db526993a:0">Bundling</span></span>

<span key="aaf7970a94274cbdb9cad6b188c93832"><span offset-key="aaf7970a94274cbdb9cad6b188c93832:0">Most React apps will have their files “bundled” using tools like </span></span><a href="https://webpack.js.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0a9047f2f2cc48dd955c35c2e821293d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="5745cc2651e344a3a5c220e317e42617"><span data-offset-key="5745cc2651e344a3a5c220e317e42617:0">Webpack</span></span></span></a><span key="97766b164d904d93b2b5aad6eea65820"><span offset-key="97766b164d904d93b2b5aad6eea65820:0">, </span></span><a href="https://rollupjs.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e47e4c729c1e481d9b7785556d8bc54f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="6739cf9da7e740468cf052a971d2f916"><span data-offset-key="6739cf9da7e740468cf052a971d2f916:0">Rollup</span></span></span></a><span key="6b7d5c424c084476a99a37523cafa30c"><span offset-key="6b7d5c424c084476a99a37523cafa30c:0"> or </span></span><a href="http://browserify.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3cbc89576e0841b8a71bb2d1c2ed90f7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="c6aff726e65a46eebf915d13c4b56257"><span data-offset-key="c6aff726e65a46eebf915d13c4b56257:0">Browserify</span></span></span></a><span key="baae491b223d4ba58ae40c4d0a03f0f0"><span offset-key="baae491b223d4ba58ae40c4d0a03f0f0:0">. Bundling is the process of following imported files and merging them into a single file: a “bundle”. This bundle can then be included on a webpage to load an entire app at once.</span></span>

### 

<span key="4994b6237c7b4823b9317b2e98fc0e05"><span offset-key="4994b6237c7b4823b9317b2e98fc0e05:0">Example</span></span>

<span key="571123ea0e964f418086701f2170e689">**App:**</span>

1

<span key="5eca2c937ead4797b6150690a6013f5b"><span offset-key="5eca2c937ead4797b6150690a6013f5b:0">// app.js</span></span>

2

<span key="07bf2ad3d33a47ffac62e45d25b213de"><span offset-key="07bf2ad3d33a47ffac62e45d25b213de:0">import { add } from './math.js';</span></span>

3

<span key="41a35846ca3642e9b0650086734cf58a"><span offset-key="41a35846ca3642e9b0650086734cf58a:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="84f6badf17f04b198af778e3ee43e35d"><span offset-key="84f6badf17f04b198af778e3ee43e35d:0">console.log(add(16, 26)); // 42</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

1

<span key="78ff59ee9c114bbe89054e92d2476a7d"><span offset-key="78ff59ee9c114bbe89054e92d2476a7d:0">// math.js</span></span>

2

<span key="b32ba95090204e00b137c519fa112daf"><span offset-key="b32ba95090204e00b137c519fa112daf:0">export function add(a, b) {</span></span>

3

<span key="1948e18a03ad4a32a77d7f40bd4f7b7d"><span offset-key="1948e18a03ad4a32a77d7f40bd4f7b7d:0"> return a + b;</span></span>

4

<span key="4667ea3f18c243bbb0da152122b72241"><span offset-key="4667ea3f18c243bbb0da152122b72241:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="4d8f11be6c83490a9d54ea2f6f4d6dab">**Bundle:**</span>

1

<span key="5dbe93c50bc240c59b62079b6b480fdc"><span offset-key="5dbe93c50bc240c59b62079b6b480fdc:0">function add(a, b) {</span></span>

2

<span key="61ce9665ddd04aee9d54770e55929561"><span offset-key="61ce9665ddd04aee9d54770e55929561:0"> return a + b;</span></span>

3

<span key="5b7fc89871e74e36b5e0ea360876a2ba"><span offset-key="5b7fc89871e74e36b5e0ea360876a2ba:0">}</span></span>

4

<span key="f9f0d7b0fc2e4a0eae087923957302a1"><span offset-key="f9f0d7b0fc2e4a0eae087923957302a1:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="b34d3923e4034d02b20ff0728412df32"><span offset-key="b34d3923e4034d02b20ff0728412df32:0">console.log(add(16, 26)); // 42</span></span>
