<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="2d441427a89b440e8bd0b8dec2b39bb1"><span offset-key="2d441427a89b440e8bd0b8dec2b39bb1:0">This HOC has the same functionality as the mutating version while avoiding the potential for clashes. It works equally well with class and function components. And because it’s a pure function, it’s composable with other HOCs, or even with itself.</span></span>

<span key="3fc6d89dbf864100be6ce536a7bf0d78"><span offset-key="3fc6d89dbf864100be6ce536a7bf0d78:0">You may have noticed similarities between HOCs and a pattern called </span>**container components**<span offset-key="3fc6d89dbf864100be6ce536a7bf0d78:2">. Container components are part of a strategy of separating responsibility between high-level and low-level concerns. Containers manage things like subscriptions and state, and pass props to components that handle things like rendering UI. HOCs use containers as part of their implementation. You can think of HOCs as parameterized container component definitions.</span></span>

# 

<span key="e4967ae6aefe4a468541ebf65fe2d4aa"><span offset-key="e4967ae6aefe4a468541ebf65fe2d4aa:0">Convention: Pass Unrelated Props Through to the Wrapped Component</span></span>

<span key="2061d887080046ae8204d60fdc6a2ae5"><span offset-key="2061d887080046ae8204d60fdc6a2ae5:0">HOCs add features to a component. They shouldn’t drastically alter its contract. It’s expected that the component returned from a HOC has a similar interface to the wrapped component.</span></span>

<span key="a9892294ec4c45989b4019da1900a002"><span offset-key="a9892294ec4c45989b4019da1900a002:0">HOCs should pass through props that are unrelated to its specific concern. Most HOCs contain a render method that looks something like this:</span></span>

1

<span key="4b7f135b2b7d4bcf93e18821558220b8"><span offset-key="4b7f135b2b7d4bcf93e18821558220b8:0">render() {</span></span>

2

<span key="d65bc8ac6ade4f3eac219580894505fa"><span offset-key="d65bc8ac6ade4f3eac219580894505fa:0"> // Filter out extra props that are specific to this HOC and shouldn't be</span></span>

3

<span key="a67c53cf91b1410fbbc68878b9babeb8"><span offset-key="a67c53cf91b1410fbbc68878b9babeb8:0"> // passed through</span></span>

4

<span key="c255391070bf49caace1913653c38da7"><span offset-key="c255391070bf49caace1913653c38da7:0"> const { extraProp, ...passThroughProps } = this.props;</span></span>

5

<span key="6e63852e1926422f9b4981e413ff9fde"><span offset-key="6e63852e1926422f9b4981e413ff9fde:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="061d2d9336734b108c1cca6263ea6942"><span offset-key="061d2d9336734b108c1cca6263ea6942:0"> // Inject props into the wrapped component. These are usually state values or</span></span>

7

<span key="0392527d81b94d55933d85e5409d0781"><span offset-key="0392527d81b94d55933d85e5409d0781:0"> // instance methods.</span></span>

8

<span key="4aadd3754fd74ccf894e393c57537d28"><span offset-key="4aadd3754fd74ccf894e393c57537d28:0"> const injectedProp = someStateOrInstanceMethod;</span></span>

9

<span key="8397067b4911467fa6f7d9b9574c9912"><span offset-key="8397067b4911467fa6f7d9b9574c9912:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

10

<span key="c7bc027d9d824371af263ccbff917299"><span offset-key="c7bc027d9d824371af263ccbff917299:0"> // Pass props to wrapped component</span></span>

11

<span key="80b4cddb17144ce8b4afa84fbadba325"><span offset-key="80b4cddb17144ce8b4afa84fbadba325:0"> return (</span></span>

12

<span key="3620a82b06c948daaecbea5c027e0b95"><span offset-key="3620a82b06c948daaecbea5c027e0b95:0"> &lt;WrappedComponentinjectedProp={injectedProp}{...passThroughProps}/>);</span></span>

13

<span key="1f90e30967784ebf9d11c48e26f0fdb8"><span offset-key="1f90e30967784ebf9d11c48e26f0fdb8:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="8fa5f22de0bf41c6b9926e3650cc0e49"><span offset-key="8fa5f22de0bf41c6b9926e3650cc0e49:0">This convention helps ensure that HOCs are as flexible and reusable as possible.</span></span>

# 

<span key="694a338c19d24e8588a3be07ec147113"><span offset-key="694a338c19d24e8588a3be07ec147113:0">Convention: Maximizing Composability</span></span>

<span key="bca5759230244009a6767b0e292904c3"><span offset-key="bca5759230244009a6767b0e292904c3:0">Not all HOCs look the same. Sometimes they accept only a single argument, the wrapped component:</span></span>

1

<span key="2d9c84c7c66c4b36bb9ae687ebe891c9"><span offset-key="2d9c84c7c66c4b36bb9ae687ebe891c9:0">const NavbarWithRouter = withRouter(Navbar);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="30b56dcc837e4970a6836c48f25fd19d"><span offset-key="30b56dcc837e4970a6836c48f25fd19d:0">Usually, HOCs accept additional arguments. In this example from Relay, a config object is used to specify a component’s data dependencies:</span></span>

1

<span key="962575114f654c399673af5f037cbded"><span offset-key="962575114f654c399673af5f037cbded:0">const CommentWithRelay = Relay.createContainer(Comment, config);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="18b3a2cd6e8e4134b14b3b71408c7743"><span offset-key="18b3a2cd6e8e4134b14b3b71408c7743:0">The most common signature for HOCs looks like this:</span></span>

1

<span key="6f9aea8ce6744979849ab7de1c40f4a6"><span offset-key="6f9aea8ce6744979849ab7de1c40f4a6:0">// React Redux's \`connect\`</span></span>

2

<span key="cd19ca1504f34dbba590b73cc6b69b4f"><span offset-key="cd19ca1504f34dbba590b73cc6b69b4f:0">const ConnectedComment = connect(commentSelector, commentActions)(CommentList);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="70f1b2eb92d3472389f446ebb488bb8d">*What?!*<span offset-key="70f1b2eb92d3472389f446ebb488bb8d:1"> If you break it apart, it’s easier to see what’s going on.</span></span>

1

<span key="9174cf932ec241798101400beb084e65"><span offset-key="9174cf932ec241798101400beb084e65:0">// connect is a function that returns another function</span></span>

2

<span key="025573bec8964ecda3cf79752d803a19"><span offset-key="025573bec8964ecda3cf79752d803a19:0">const enhance = connect(commentListSelector, commentListActions);</span></span>

3

<span key="7df6de1bf53942ae90c4aaa07ccc07b9"><span offset-key="7df6de1bf53942ae90c4aaa07ccc07b9:0">// The returned function is a HOC, which returns a component that is connected</span></span>

4

<span key="17c8d4c16c004fb696dd358ce6f74758"><span offset-key="17c8d4c16c004fb696dd358ce6f74758:0">// to the Redux store</span></span>

5

<span key="d7ed430867314b088a6f4da0eac8a454"><span offset-key="d7ed430867314b088a6f4da0eac8a454:0">const ConnectedComment = enhance(CommentList);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="815d7404bcb44bdfb133dbd7550f4f08"><span offset-key="815d7404bcb44bdfb133dbd7550f4f08:0">In other words, </span>`connect`<span offset-key="815d7404bcb44bdfb133dbd7550f4f08:2"> is a higher-order function that returns a higher-order component!</span></span>

<span key="2ac39234fbef4df2bd9307f472de6eea"><span offset-key="2ac39234fbef4df2bd9307f472de6eea:0">This form may seem confusing or unnecessary, but it has a useful property. Single-argument HOCs like the one returned by the </span>`connect`<span offset-key="2ac39234fbef4df2bd9307f472de6eea:2"> function have the signature </span>`Component => Component`<span offset-key="2ac39234fbef4df2bd9307f472de6eea:4">. Functions whose output type is the same as its input type are really easy to compose together.</span></span>

1

<span key="6a201aae619a49fabc632569e2f5ce41"><span offset-key="6a201aae619a49fabc632569e2f5ce41:0">// Instead of doing this...</span></span>

2

<span key="20c767c9f72244b3bce016a9c40db93b"><span offset-key="20c767c9f72244b3bce016a9c40db93b:0">const EnhancedComponent = withRouter(connect(commentSelector)(WrappedComponent))</span></span>

3

<span key="f9e0698a184a430e8fdebaa491ff6c76"><span offset-key="f9e0698a184a430e8fdebaa491ff6c76:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="4a81c1771cc141218cf4df5749faf5b9"><span offset-key="4a81c1771cc141218cf4df5749faf5b9:0">// ... you can use a function composition utility</span></span>

5

<span key="c9191084d173451bb1d01af4e364293c"><span offset-key="c9191084d173451bb1d01af4e364293c:0">// compose(f, g, h) is the same as (...args) => f(g(h(...args)))</span></span>

6

<span key="f910983179bb4a6a84097345f56f1f00"><span offset-key="f910983179bb4a6a84097345f56f1f00:0">const enhance = compose(</span></span>

7

<span key="d047bec565b240d6b41e60324a49e624"><span offset-key="d047bec565b240d6b41e60324a49e624:0"> // These are both single-argument HOCs</span></span>

8

<span key="47aaf4685a154c6c9aade925cb5bc75b"><span offset-key="47aaf4685a154c6c9aade925cb5bc75b:0"> withRouter,</span></span>

9

<span key="207d151233134611ace70f624483ff57"><span offset-key="207d151233134611ace70f624483ff57:0"> connect(commentSelector)</span></span>

10

<span key="87a79826a6c84a2d9d517b81d1417c1f"><span offset-key="87a79826a6c84a2d9d517b81d1417c1f:0">)</span></span>

11

<span key="2b38584fc8b54347a3f5bc8ffc3c61e1"><span offset-key="2b38584fc8b54347a3f5bc8ffc3c61e1:0">const EnhancedComponent = enhance(WrappedComponent)</span></span>

Copied!

<span key="06b6d56cf640484ebb90601c65f74932"><span offset-key="06b6d56cf640484ebb90601c65f74932:0">(This same property also allows </span>`connect`<span offset-key="06b6d56cf640484ebb90601c65f74932:2"> and other enhancer-style HOCs to be used as decorators, an experimental JavaScript proposal.)</span></span>

<span key="e0955b0ea31e48389c57e393bf7f3be8"><span offset-key="e0955b0ea31e48389c57e393bf7f3be8:0">The </span>`compose`<span offset-key="e0955b0ea31e48389c57e393bf7f3be8:2"> utility function is provided by many third-party libraries including lodash (as </span>`[lodash.flowRight](<https://lodash.com/docs/#flowRight>)`<span offset-key="e0955b0ea31e48389c57e393bf7f3be8:4">), </span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/api/compose" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="279d7b57ca824b1bb1096cdcaea2d246" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="d50efe381df7499f963b735c2aa68037"><span data-offset-key="d50efe381df7499f963b735c2aa68037:0">Redux</span></span></span></a><span key="35ee281d91fa495e8e9607acbeaab7aa"><span offset-key="35ee281d91fa495e8e9607acbeaab7aa:0">, and </span></span><a href="https://ramdajs.com/docs/#compose" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4f33babed09a4648b86e695318af4077" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="b0a05fd81c554cf59bc95e4dff83737d"><span data-offset-key="b0a05fd81c554cf59bc95e4dff83737d:0">Ramda</span></span></span></a><span key="f0d3ce163fb4414082a254d82d15eb5c"><span offset-key="f0d3ce163fb4414082a254d82d15eb5c:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="23f8e8f6453346779cdc9969c1d855d1"><span offset-key="23f8e8f6453346779cdc9969c1d855d1:0">Convention: Wrap the Display Name for Easy Debugging</span></span>

<span key="7cffb94984e149a78bcd5cbfaaaf9c49"><span offset-key="7cffb94984e149a78bcd5cbfaaaf9c49:0">The container components created by HOCs show up in the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/facebook/react/tree/main/packages/react-devtools" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="12eef1699778461d93feddc42e9cd48a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="78914b8b373b431981611ec6e1f9e272"><span data-offset-key="78914b8b373b431981611ec6e1f9e272:0">React Developer Tools</span></span></span></a><span key="67e26aad9e664a7db347ff6ce901eb60"><span offset-key="67e26aad9e664a7db347ff6ce901eb60:0"> like any other component. To ease debugging, choose a display name that communicates that it’s the result of a HOC.</span></span>

<span key="5dfe726556b24c03a655af993fd0dc03"><span offset-key="5dfe726556b24c03a655af993fd0dc03:0">The most common technique is to wrap the display name of the wrapped component. So if your higher-order component is named </span>`withSubscription`<span offset-key="5dfe726556b24c03a655af993fd0dc03:2">, and the wrapped component’s display name is </span>`CommentList`<span offset-key="5dfe726556b24c03a655af993fd0dc03:4">, use the display name </span>`WithSubscription(CommentList)`<span offset-key="5dfe726556b24c03a655af993fd0dc03:6">:</span></span>

1

<span key="6872a02e8dc441f093a870f5f8603151"><span offset-key="6872a02e8dc441f093a870f5f8603151:0">function withSubscription(WrappedComponent) {</span></span>

2

<span key="d6f97895a7da44ffbe0d86b6cd0282d6"><span offset-key="d6f97895a7da44ffbe0d86b6cd0282d6:0"> class WithSubscription extends React.Component {/\* ... \*/}</span></span>

3

<span key="c43e1732b1274ed794d074d0f3c1fa6b"><span offset-key="c43e1732b1274ed794d074d0f3c1fa6b:0"> WithSubscription.displayName = \`WithSubscription(${getDisplayName(WrappedComponent)})\`;</span></span>

4

<span key="88b86ed8c0a04496a05cc4a83d2a9ce2"><span offset-key="88b86ed8c0a04496a05cc4a83d2a9ce2:0"> return WithSubscription;</span></span>

5

<span key="88f963a055cc40a5a5dabca196910508"><span offset-key="88f963a055cc40a5a5dabca196910508:0">}</span></span>

6

<span key="c41301a2f10142e3b3d7fa964158c05f"><span offset-key="c41301a2f10142e3b3d7fa964158c05f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="d1355323b15d4d9c80205c6ef6fdcf43"><span offset-key="d1355323b15d4d9c80205c6ef6fdcf43:0">function getDisplayName(WrappedComponent) {</span></span>

8

<span key="a329eb3912c14190949ebb38ca1ad31b"><span offset-key="a329eb3912c14190949ebb38ca1ad31b:0"> return WrappedComponent.displayName || WrappedComponent.name || 'Component';</span></span>

9

<span key="5e7ce53e70b54127a79a5c8215e211a8"><span offset-key="5e7ce53e70b54127a79a5c8215e211a8:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

# 

<span key="30ee33e569ae42258d4806780c94b4c5"><span offset-key="30ee33e569ae42258d4806780c94b4c5:0">Caveats</span></span>

<span key="a63c6adf70e84b60b038a364d46d3265"><span offset-key="a63c6adf70e84b60b038a364d46d3265:0">Higher-order components come with a few caveats that aren’t immediately obvious if you’re new to React.</span></span>

# 

<span key="39d6f042c77f48b1991ed83b01ec47f2"><span offset-key="39d6f042c77f48b1991ed83b01ec47f2:0">Don’t Use HOCs Inside the render Method</span></span>

<span key="44d72f3a6309435195a01f2a6a4f06c5"><span offset-key="44d72f3a6309435195a01f2a6a4f06c5:0">React’s diffing algorithm (called </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/reconciliation.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ad5f2538247a4173814d168502488c23" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="c8fb37643c714aa0bf40210af55a8d04"><span data-offset-key="c8fb37643c714aa0bf40210af55a8d04:0">Reconciliation</span></span></span></a><span key="251bbc4dc2b8444fabe15086d2452a1b"><span offset-key="251bbc4dc2b8444fabe15086d2452a1b:0">) uses component identity to determine whether it should update the existing subtree or throw it away and mount a new one. If the component returned from </span>`render`<span offset-key="251bbc4dc2b8444fabe15086d2452a1b:2"> is identical (</span>`===`<span offset-key="251bbc4dc2b8444fabe15086d2452a1b:4">) to the component from the previous render, React recursively updates the subtree by diffing it with the new one. If they’re not equal, the previous subtree is unmounted completely.</span></span>

<span key="67ced4d746374a18af47dfe66a399d39"><span offset-key="67ced4d746374a18af47dfe66a399d39:0">Normally, you shouldn’t need to think about this. But it matters for HOCs because it means you can’t apply a HOC to a component within the render method of a component:</span></span>

1

<span key="4352943e07db41cd83fb7589013904ec"><span offset-key="4352943e07db41cd83fb7589013904ec:0">render() {</span></span>

2

<span key="bc4ed151cb8a49e4969b2e7ed9e9ddba"><span offset-key="bc4ed151cb8a49e4969b2e7ed9e9ddba:0"> // A new version of EnhancedComponent is created on every render</span></span>

3

<span key="d35ee32084e84cbf87f590f6d1f561ba"><span offset-key="d35ee32084e84cbf87f590f6d1f561ba:0"> // EnhancedComponent1 !== EnhancedComponent2</span></span>

4

<span key="0cd8a4dab06a4432b80097948be808db"><span offset-key="0cd8a4dab06a4432b80097948be808db:0"> const EnhancedComponent = enhance(MyComponent);</span></span>

5

<span key="1bb988b1c68b4afc8f7558580f4b3868"><span offset-key="1bb988b1c68b4afc8f7558580f4b3868:0"> // That causes the entire subtree to unmount/remount each time!</span></span>

6

<span key="f8b2959a23874ea28a88ea82669b08d9"><span offset-key="f8b2959a23874ea28a88ea82669b08d9:0"> return &lt;EnhancedComponent />;</span></span>

7

<span key="6d3623d1500a4612b4538c2f53afea24"><span offset-key="6d3623d1500a4612b4538c2f53afea24:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="d25f1abce7004401ae019ed07ee98607"><span offset-key="d25f1abce7004401ae019ed07ee98607:0">The problem here isn’t just about performance — remounting a component causes the state of that component and all of its children to be lost.</span></span>

<span key="ee12f68151ed41ec980b141d19a219ec"><span offset-key="ee12f68151ed41ec980b141d19a219ec:0">Instead, apply HOCs outside the component definition so that the resulting component is created only once. Then, its identity will be consistent across renders. This is usually what you want, anyway.</span></span>

<span key="81483c22bce34418bf229645268c0245"><span offset-key="81483c22bce34418bf229645268c0245:0">In those rare cases where you need to apply a HOC dynamically, you can also do it inside a component’s lifecycle methods or its constructor.</span></span>

# 

<span key="4f580948366f453aaa9765db2b4ad0f9"><span offset-key="4f580948366f453aaa9765db2b4ad0f9:0">Static Methods Must Be Copied Over</span></span>

<span key="a5302e6dba5044e3999ec7e2d064fb8e"><span offset-key="a5302e6dba5044e3999ec7e2d064fb8e:0">Sometimes it’s useful to define a static method on a React component. For example, Relay containers expose a static method </span>`getFragment`<span offset-key="a5302e6dba5044e3999ec7e2d064fb8e:2"> to facilitate the composition of GraphQL fragments.</span></span>

<span key="0aa38a22eeaa4f0aafc0520d776d719f"><span offset-key="0aa38a22eeaa4f0aafc0520d776d719f:0">When you apply a HOC to a component, though, the original component is wrapped with a container component. That means the new component does not have any of the static methods of the original component.</span></span>

1

<span key="dbd310fb9b5c4a7898d6a96fe697cc57"><span offset-key="dbd310fb9b5c4a7898d6a96fe697cc57:0">// Define a static method</span></span>

2

<span key="bae1d507bc364acf82727ab0f041c113"><span offset-key="bae1d507bc364acf82727ab0f041c113:0">WrappedComponent.staticMethod = function() {/\*...\*/}</span></span>

3

<span key="93461baad6804bd2a0bef969e410bdee"><span offset-key="93461baad6804bd2a0bef969e410bdee:0">// Now apply a HOC</span></span>

4

<span key="dfbd669de68f428d94b19d335c559c20"><span offset-key="dfbd669de68f428d94b19d335c559c20:0">const EnhancedComponent = enhance(WrappedComponent);</span></span>

5

<span key="9d26bb8390a147919c3bcdcdf62ab8e0"><span offset-key="9d26bb8390a147919c3bcdcdf62ab8e0:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="56d89939a8784417b8f97b415c1953d3"><span offset-key="56d89939a8784417b8f97b415c1953d3:0">// The enhanced component has no static method</span></span>

7

<span key="fd0c2c54a59d43ec850c576ce81a146a"><span offset-key="fd0c2c54a59d43ec850c576ce81a146a:0">typeof EnhancedComponent.staticMethod === 'undefined' // true</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="d222fcc985a54dfbbb332fa7cc1ee781"><span offset-key="d222fcc985a54dfbbb332fa7cc1ee781:0">To solve this, you could copy the methods onto the container before returning it:</span></span>

1

<span key="ba73c28491324ec3a87cbeacfe6ad4df"><span offset-key="ba73c28491324ec3a87cbeacfe6ad4df:0">function enhance(WrappedComponent) {</span></span>

2

<span key="cbb0b3cd4efa4e40904e60fea3f8ceff"><span offset-key="cbb0b3cd4efa4e40904e60fea3f8ceff:0"> class Enhance extends React.Component {/\*...\*/}</span></span>

3

<span key="afe9b13092c94a9d8e0f5e830e8070d5"><span offset-key="afe9b13092c94a9d8e0f5e830e8070d5:0"> // Must know exactly which method(s) to copy :(</span></span>

4

<span key="a65648b5e8994de09a02c07b33c215d5"><span offset-key="a65648b5e8994de09a02c07b33c215d5:0"> Enhance.staticMethod = WrappedComponent.staticMethod;</span></span>

5

<span key="cabe5692a8c94d8ca4a350105801d2a1"><span offset-key="cabe5692a8c94d8ca4a350105801d2a1:0"> return Enhance;</span></span>

6

<span key="4e7578af99e348b8819272eadf64a228"><span offset-key="4e7578af99e348b8819272eadf64a228:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="093f564b835b48ababb1caa167d9202d"><span offset-key="093f564b835b48ababb1caa167d9202d:0">However, this requires you to know exactly which methods need to be copied. You can use </span></span><a href="https://github.com/mridgway/hoist-non-react-statics" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9b72b5409e4a4bcda848bd4455e06a57" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="ae1056074d3542be9b9a723cbdb8d214"><span data-offset-key="ae1056074d3542be9b9a723cbdb8d214:0">hoist-non-react-statics</span></span></span></a><span key="4d79a72483a94d5e8ae2653824ed1206"><span offset-key="4d79a72483a94d5e8ae2653824ed1206:0"> to automatically copy all non-React static methods:</span></span>

1

<span key="836e89f6e62c43b786e217f7dfa64791"><span offset-key="836e89f6e62c43b786e217f7dfa64791:0">import hoistNonReactStatic from 'hoist-non-react-statics';</span></span>

2

<span key="8a30606a270647c3819457c16391b9bb"><span offset-key="8a30606a270647c3819457c16391b9bb:0">function enhance(WrappedComponent) {</span></span>

<span key="fb4cc0ead56e4198ac75ea371ac21e65"><span offset-key="fb4cc0ead56e4198ac75ea371ac21e65:0"> hoistNonReactStatic(Enhance, WrappedComponent);</span></span>

<span key="ab7b8622ad1e4e9bb8a952b05528d153"><span offset-key="ab7b8622ad1e4e9bb8a952b05528d153:0">Another possible solution is to export the static method separately from the component itself.</span></span>

# 

<span key="64aeba2c64164dd29c9128d187c9fc51"><span offset-key="64aeba2c64164dd29c9128d187c9fc51:0">Refs Aren’t Passed Through</span></span>

<span key="182e06a0877d465d8d227dcec3c3c1f0"><span offset-key="182e06a0877d465d8d227dcec3c3c1f0:0">While the convention for higher-order components is to pass through all props to the wrapped component, this does not work for refs. That’s because </span>`ref`<span offset-key="182e06a0877d465d8d227dcec3c3c1f0:2"> is not really a prop — like </span>`key`<span offset-key="182e06a0877d465d8d227dcec3c3c1f0:4">, it’s handled specially by React. If you add a ref to an element whose component is the result of a HOC, the ref refers to an instance of the outermost container component, not the wrapped component.</span></span>

<span key="f25fade601bc42f795c0701d909f4c20"><span offset-key="f25fade601bc42f795c0701d909f4c20:0">The solution for this problem is to use the </span>`React.forwardRef`<span offset-key="f25fade601bc42f795c0701d909f4c20:2"> API (introduced with React 16.3). </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/forwarding-refs.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="28d1cfd4a0b34500969441b24e6eff60" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="57f30598010d4505b56f6b8e975293ab"><span data-offset-key="57f30598010d4505b56f6b8e975293ab:0">Learn more about it in the forwarding refs section</span></span></span></a><span key="06a247955e9f4d24a9aaa135dfa83f6e"><span offset-key="06a247955e9f4d24a9aaa135dfa83f6e:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="5d95ac4b700a4d71a470d5f43f31b98b">**JSX In Depth**</span>

# 

<span key="2a33a4d096094ca0b41e0e1999ec84df"><span offset-key="2a33a4d096094ca0b41e0e1999ec84df:0">Fundamentally, JSX just provides syntactic sugar for the </span>`React.createElement(component, props, ...children)`<span offset-key="2a33a4d096094ca0b41e0e1999ec84df:2"> function. The JSX code:</span></span>

1

<span key="784a3d15e77d475dbf54fe8184b83c01"><span offset-key="784a3d15e77d475dbf54fe8184b83c01:0">&lt;MyButton color="blue" shadowSize={2}></span></span>

2

<span key="d7363a4336554b42b25cc3aa48367651"><span offset-key="d7363a4336554b42b25cc3aa48367651:0"> Click Me</span></span>

3

<span key="0249afa6be5342a59752a23ad9a9b49a"><span offset-key="0249afa6be5342a59752a23ad9a9b49a:0">&lt;/MyButton></span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="09521d6588b64d79a85b3ec1d85e4e6e"><span offset-key="09521d6588b64d79a85b3ec1d85e4e6e:0">compiles into:</span></span>

1

<span key="3b52d63a513c480e881cccfbb6e90669"><span offset-key="3b52d63a513c480e881cccfbb6e90669:0">React.createElement(</span></span>

2

<span key="fdca376ea48d4a9e833e9bb68dedc162"><span offset-key="fdca376ea48d4a9e833e9bb68dedc162:0"> MyButton,</span></span>

3

<span key="8d843d9058d94b8d9b5d0dad5cffeb5c"><span offset-key="8d843d9058d94b8d9b5d0dad5cffeb5c:0"> {color: 'blue', shadowSize: 2},</span></span>

4

<span key="6a3ba3a190d64b5f9904d083dd4acef6"><span offset-key="6a3ba3a190d64b5f9904d083dd4acef6:0"> 'Click Me'</span></span>

5

<span key="54fa0deafbd443debfd4a5fdb017ad67"><span offset-key="54fa0deafbd443debfd4a5fdb017ad67:0">)</span></span>

Copied!

<span key="2b140025950944c4a6354a177371b4ed"><span offset-key="2b140025950944c4a6354a177371b4ed:0">You can also use the self-closing form of the tag if there are no children. So:</span></span>

1

<span key="35a98f4b25ff4f36a6d54746234af608"><span offset-key="35a98f4b25ff4f36a6d54746234af608:0">If you want to test out how some specific JSX is converted into JavaScript, you can try out </span></span><a href="https://babeljs.io/repl/#?presets=react&amp;code_lz=GYVwdgxgLglg9mABACwKYBt1wBQEpEDeAUIogE6pQhlIA8AJjAG4B8AEhlogO5xnr0AhLQD0jVgG4iAXyJA" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b4a5ad9a55884d34accacb08011ac7da" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-30856_259-30857-237__"><span data-key="a8090006f3ab48d1b297918ee72ebefc"><span data-offset-key="a8090006f3ab48d1b297918ee72ebefc:0">the online Babel compiler</span></span></span></a><span key="34773f472d0e43bbbd72756e10d1f210"><span offset-key="34773f472d0e43bbbd72756e10d1f210:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="ef439e71b3164f2f9cbc23e920451ff0"><span offset-key="ef439e71b3164f2f9cbc23e920451ff0:0">Specifying The React Element Type</span></span>

<span key="98a1f8f7626547b79691d7dacaa72ebe"><span offset-key="98a1f8f7626547b79691d7dacaa72ebe:0">The first part of a JSX tag determines the type of the React element.</span></span>

<span key="052fa3582a454924b3b58003f1442fd2"><span offset-key="052fa3582a454924b3b58003f1442fd2:0">Capitalized types indicate that the JSX tag is referring to a React component. These tags get compiled into a direct reference to the named variable, so if you use the JSX </span>`<Foo />`<span offset-key="052fa3582a454924b3b58003f1442fd2:2"> expression, </span>`Foo`<span offset-key="052fa3582a454924b3b58003f1442fd2:4"> must be in scope.</span></span>

# 

<span key="fbe6be025a3d4a82976440d1b8b2f82e"><span offset-key="fbe6be025a3d4a82976440d1b8b2f82e:0">React Must Be in Scope</span></span>

<span key="08811d2ee3fd4ca68f84fe8c46285cea"><span offset-key="08811d2ee3fd4ca68f84fe8c46285cea:0">Since JSX compiles into calls to </span>`React.createElement`<span offset-key="08811d2ee3fd4ca68f84fe8c46285cea:2">, the </span>`React`<span offset-key="08811d2ee3fd4ca68f84fe8c46285cea:4"> library must also always be in scope from your JSX code.</span></span>

<span key="46d01bffd4e24bcab6a43db0e17f8512"><span offset-key="46d01bffd4e24bcab6a43db0e17f8512:0">For example, both of the imports are necessary in this code, even though </span>`React`<span offset-key="46d01bffd4e24bcab6a43db0e17f8512:2"> and </span>`CustomButton`<span offset-key="46d01bffd4e24bcab6a43db0e17f8512:4"> are not directly referenced from JavaScript:</span></span>

1

<span key="35781d42f5564503a33de5658c8fc809"><span offset-key="35781d42f5564503a33de5658c8fc809:0">import React from 'react';import CustomButton from './CustomButton';function WarningButton() {</span></span>

2

<span key="461dae24966745658c7b6186dc6e3a54"><span offset-key="461dae24966745658c7b6186dc6e3a54:0"> // return React.createElement(CustomButton, {color: 'red'}, null); return &lt;CustomButton color="red" />;</span></span>

3

<span key="601673b651624273a17337e2cd3cce7e"><span offset-key="601673b651624273a17337e2cd3cce7e:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="cba1ffcf69b844a1bbc38e8342a74217"><span offset-key="cba1ffcf69b844a1bbc38e8342a74217:0">If you don’t use a JavaScript bundler and loaded React from a </span>`<script>`<span offset-key="cba1ffcf69b844a1bbc38e8342a74217:2"> tag, it is already in scope as the </span>`React`<span offset-key="cba1ffcf69b844a1bbc38e8342a74217:4"> global.</span></span>

# 

<span key="362ae6de30bf4a7e9abe0def69660e9d"><span offset-key="362ae6de30bf4a7e9abe0def69660e9d:0">Using Dot Notation for JSX Type</span></span>

<span key="46f2c31ac2774670933c880c1a0e2813"><span offset-key="46f2c31ac2774670933c880c1a0e2813:0">You can also refer to a React component using dot-notation from within JSX. This is convenient if you have a single module that exports many React components. For example, if </span>`MyComponents.DatePicker`<span offset-key="46f2c31ac2774670933c880c1a0e2813:2"> is a component, you can use it directly from JSX with:</span></span>

1

<span key="45a2e2bf46f8420aa915ecb8276216df"><span offset-key="45a2e2bf46f8420aa915ecb8276216df:0">import React from 'react';</span></span>

2

<span key="9a9ac138be004414be6ff5e3754eade9"><span offset-key="9a9ac138be004414be6ff5e3754eade9:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="29128e239c484826a10a9b78d096b2bd"><span offset-key="29128e239c484826a10a9b78d096b2bd:0">const MyComponents = {</span></span>

4

<span key="d9d0d643e9734214a4ee4138870975c1"><span offset-key="d9d0d643e9734214a4ee4138870975c1:0"> DatePicker: function DatePicker(props) {</span></span>

5

<span key="61c071f1d65f491ba86ef0c120a093a7"><span offset-key="61c071f1d65f491ba86ef0c120a093a7:0"> return &lt;div>Imagine a {props.color} datepicker here.&lt;/div>;</span></span>

6

<span key="f258e7709b8e413586fe34f1fdce96d5"><span offset-key="f258e7709b8e413586fe34f1fdce96d5:0"> }</span></span>

7

<span key="9df92de63ad3403a9745da4c37e59d1f"><span offset-key="9df92de63ad3403a9745da4c37e59d1f:0">}</span></span>

8

<span key="a1ff3fca105343f3b35959529f8d735f"><span offset-key="a1ff3fca105343f3b35959529f8d735f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="c49f3e845f7d4e588018ce1dedfec8e8"><span offset-key="c49f3e845f7d4e588018ce1dedfec8e8:0">User-Defined Components Must Be Capitalized</span></span>

<span key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653"><span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:0">When an element type starts with a lowercase letter, it refers to a built-in component like </span>`<div>`<span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:2"> or </span>`<span>`<span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:4"> and results in a string </span>`'div'`<span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:6"> or </span>`'span'`<span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:8"> passed to </span>`React.createElement`<span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:10">. Types that start with a capital letter like </span>`<Foo />`<span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:12"> compile to </span>`React.createElement(Foo)`<span offset-key="1ef1f91c5fcf4b10a14e3a15597c8653:14"> and correspond to a component defined or imported in your JavaScript file.</span></span>

<span key="0ce81fd06cbe4f0eb6c026f5dcb37282"><span offset-key="0ce81fd06cbe4f0eb6c026f5dcb37282:0">We recommend naming components with a capital letter. If you do have a component that starts with a lowercase letter, assign it to a capitalized variable before using it in JSX.</span></span>

<span key="973b4e97216f4da6a1e8f5e9eafbecbf"><span offset-key="973b4e97216f4da6a1e8f5e9eafbecbf:0">For example, this code will not run as expected:</span></span>

1

<span key="c12dd9d968f44597829db3266bbe3618"><span offset-key="c12dd9d968f44597829db3266bbe3618:0">import React from 'react';</span></span>

2

<span key="60b0eebee22241d888f16a1acea37fce"><span offset-key="60b0eebee22241d888f16a1acea37fce:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="465062ab0f4844fba8ecaf21b78e070f"><span offset-key="465062ab0f4844fba8ecaf21b78e070f:0">// Wrong! This is a component and should have been capitalized:function hello(props) { // Correct! This use of &lt;div> is legitimate because div is a valid HTML tag:</span></span>

4

<span key="0aee3c042ef0465bacc869cb83937d32"><span offset-key="0aee3c042ef0465bacc869cb83937d32:0"> return &lt;div>Hello {props.toWhat}&lt;/div>;</span></span>

5

<span key="2174b9e705704f47b017382a4f0e483d"><span offset-key="2174b9e705704f47b017382a4f0e483d:0">}</span></span>

6

<span key="cc1ca3c19d634f2d9e6837c17f25d91c"><span offset-key="cc1ca3c19d634f2d9e6837c17f25d91c:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="780c74a575c14fa688f1a33ca2545d68"><span offset-key="780c74a575c14fa688f1a33ca2545d68:0">function HelloWorld() {</span></span>

8

<span key="99b6bb5d3e7b4afa9ac8f94cdfe9fc8f"><span offset-key="99b6bb5d3e7b4afa9ac8f94cdfe9fc8f:0"> // Wrong! React thinks &lt;hello /> is an HTML tag because it's not capitalized: return &lt;hello toWhat="World" />;}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="c64c4df957ec45f8840f672f18b40b41"><span offset-key="c64c4df957ec45f8840f672f18b40b41:0">To fix this, we will rename </span>`hello`<span offset-key="c64c4df957ec45f8840f672f18b40b41:2"> to </span>`Hello`<span offset-key="c64c4df957ec45f8840f672f18b40b41:4"> and use </span>`<Hello />`<span offset-key="c64c4df957ec45f8840f672f18b40b41:6"> when referring to it:</span></span>

1

<span key="be41ec54b4f74816b3cbac6de10d75c6"><span offset-key="be41ec54b4f74816b3cbac6de10d75c6:0">import React from 'react';</span></span>

2

<span key="7abe086551fb47f59f0206ed790093c1"><span offset-key="7abe086551fb47f59f0206ed790093c1:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="323cec6c6cd3426a860fe5a0b706d3b3"><span offset-key="323cec6c6cd3426a860fe5a0b706d3b3:0">// Correct! This is a component and should be capitalized:function Hello(props) { // Correct! This use of &lt;div> is legitimate because div is a valid HTML tag:</span></span>

4

<span key="b632617919304e0496c29ad18efd20c9"><span offset-key="b632617919304e0496c29ad18efd20c9:0"> return &lt;div>Hello {props.toWhat}&lt;/div>;</span></span>

5

<span key="de2b7d8e93ee48c39cc2173e4a2ad579"><span offset-key="de2b7d8e93ee48c39cc2173e4a2ad579:0">}</span></span>

6

<span key="75caf58eabcf498e9526e92f57255ad6"><span offset-key="75caf58eabcf498e9526e92f57255ad6:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="17241efe7dd64f73a061d987f1485a5d"><span offset-key="17241efe7dd64f73a061d987f1485a5d:0">function HelloWorld() {</span></span>

8

<span key="f7f621a09c7140bd93da0aab3e2d5b23"><span offset-key="f7f621a09c7140bd93da0aab3e2d5b23:0"> // Correct! React knows &lt;Hello /> is a component because it's capitalized. return &lt;Hello toWhat="World" />;}</span></span>

Copied!

# 

<span key="915a07ce79434069b9452d4f03addbb9"><span offset-key="915a07ce79434069b9452d4f03addbb9:0">Choosing the Type at Runtime</span></span>

<span key="215e4efe69494444b56cc716a05dd9ab"><span offset-key="215e4efe69494444b56cc716a05dd9ab:0">You cannot use a general expression as the React element type. If you do want to use a general expression to indicate the type of the element, just assign it to a capitalized variable first. This often comes up when you want to render a different component based on a prop:</span></span>

1

<span key="4fd76529bd77486e822e2dfb0b3120b9"><span offset-key="4fd76529bd77486e822e2dfb0b3120b9:0">import React from 'react';</span></span>

2

<span key="91a88c65cbc345e7a0e159611043cbfa"><span offset-key="91a88c65cbc345e7a0e159611043cbfa:0">import { PhotoStory, VideoStory } from './stories';</span></span>

3

<span key="292be9fa724745e59a37cacd53bf92db"><span offset-key="292be9fa724745e59a37cacd53bf92db:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="b4fdb3e0abd049ee8dcc3d98d5442d86"><span offset-key="b4fdb3e0abd049ee8dcc3d98d5442d86:0">const components = {</span></span>

5

<span key="ea6e58541dc74260b635097d0d1b87d1"><span offset-key="ea6e58541dc74260b635097d0d1b87d1:0"> photo: PhotoStory,</span></span>

6

<span key="9b426b6dad014e25bb9243ee91910d64"><span offset-key="9b426b6dad014e25bb9243ee91910d64:0"> video: VideoStory</span></span>

7

<span key="a6ead64b276c40918ab7aba33366283b"><span offset-key="a6ead64b276c40918ab7aba33366283b:0">};</span></span>

8

<span key="cdea3cd4f29645048dd3a97b3410cf65"><span offset-key="cdea3cd4f29645048dd3a97b3410cf65:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

9

<span key="0016e86e241a42ed806e5f00544730ec"><span offset-key="0016e86e241a42ed806e5f00544730ec:0">function Story(props) {</span></span>

10

<span key="24ad5b8dd5374eee8972a00ff7be1a18"><span offset-key="24ad5b8dd5374eee8972a00ff7be1a18:0"> // Wrong! JSX type can't be an expression. return &lt;components\[props.storyType\] story={props.story} />;}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="70650be81b4e49dfbafb5e3fd561c1df"><span offset-key="70650be81b4e49dfbafb5e3fd561c1df:0">To fix this, we will assign the type to a capitalized variable first:</span></span>

1

<span key="660ce54bc4bd4782a31e8c8c88fec846"><span offset-key="660ce54bc4bd4782a31e8c8c88fec846:0">import React from 'react';</span></span>

2

<span key="d7291f3360ee46348622643a6a0fe937"><span offset-key="d7291f3360ee46348622643a6a0fe937:0">import { PhotoStory, VideoStory } from './stories';</span></span>

3

<span key="815424116b364358852d916462518e7e"><span offset-key="815424116b364358852d916462518e7e:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="e1790b85f790479d80302df9d2bfe289"><span offset-key="e1790b85f790479d80302df9d2bfe289:0">const components = {</span></span>

5

<span key="33739376f7cf41d5842b71939fe8e071"><span offset-key="33739376f7cf41d5842b71939fe8e071:0"> photo: PhotoStory,</span></span>

6

<span key="0fa8f2c8f3ef4bf8a5af255dd15e8792"><span offset-key="0fa8f2c8f3ef4bf8a5af255dd15e8792:0"> video: VideoStory</span></span>

7

<span key="267f618a2b3d4e11b484768d76c428a6"><span offset-key="267f618a2b3d4e11b484768d76c428a6:0">};</span></span>

8

<span key="880cbb3311084aad9c77ceb3aa3d1fb0"><span offset-key="880cbb3311084aad9c77ceb3aa3d1fb0:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

9

<span key="ef8f81aab729451ea5404b74a7a9c060"><span offset-key="ef8f81aab729451ea5404b74a7a9c060:0">function Story(props) {</span></span>

10

<span key="a6788c257d3e4ae79c32ad0668794012"><span offset-key="a6788c257d3e4ae79c32ad0668794012:0"> // Correct! JSX type can be a capitalized variable. const SpecificStory = components\[props.storyType\]; return &lt;SpecificStory story={props.story} />;}</span></span>
